sentences.text: To Our Shareowners:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend the Annual Meeting of Shareowners of Honeywell, which will be held at 10:30 a.m. on Monday, April 24, 2017 at our headquarters, 115 Tabor Road, Morris Plains, New Jersey 07950.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The accompanying notice of meeting and proxy statement describe the matters to be voted on at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At this years meeting, you will be asked to elect directors, cast advisory votes on executive compensation and the frequency of future advisory votes on executive compensation, approve the appointment of the independent accountants, and consider two shareowner proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR Proposals 1, 3 and 4 and 1 Year for Proposal 2:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 4: Approval of Independent Accountants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 6: Political Lobbying and Contributions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: YOUR VOTE IS IMPORTANT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to read the proxy statement and vote your shares as soon as possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowners may vote via the Internet, by telephone, by completing and returning a proxy card or by scanning the QR code provided on the next page in the Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareowners or on the proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specific voting instructions are set forth in the proxy statement and on both the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials and proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On behalf of the Board of Directors, we want to thank you for your continued support of Honeywell.

sentences.text: Best Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors oversees management performance on behalf of the shareowners to ensure that the long-term interests of the shareowners are being served, to monitor adherence to Honeywell standards and policies, and to promote the exercise of responsible corporate citizenship.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GOVERNANCE HIGHLIGHTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors are independent other than the CEO and COO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Board Committees are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual election of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Majority voting in uncontested elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adopted proxy access By-law amendment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chair of the Corporate Governance and Responsibility Committee or Lead Director can call special meetings of the Board at any time for any reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Three Audit Committee members are designated audit committee financial experts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A diverse Board23% are women, 23% are Hispanic, 15% are African American and 15% are non-U.S. citizens.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowner right to call a special meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Simple majority vote requirements to amend charter and approve mergers and acquisitions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No poison pill in place; Board will seek shareowner approval if a shareowner rights plan is adopted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Robust year-round shareowner engagement, including discussions between larger shareowners and directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regular executive sessions of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk oversight by full Board and Committees, including strengthened cybersecurity oversight by the Audit Committee and full Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strong commitment to corporate social responsibility and sustainability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No use of corporate funds for political contributions and careful oversight of political lobbying activities.

sentences.text: Board Nominees Skills, Qualifications, Tenure and Diversity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board nominees possess the right skills, qualifications and business expertise to provide sound judgment, insightful perspectives and guidance in a constantly changing environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we believe that electing directors with a mix of tenures facilitates effective Board oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Careful consideration is made to achieve the appropriate balance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors with many years of service to Honeywell provide the Board with a deep knowledge of our Company, while newer directors lend fresh perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Diversity in terms of gender, race and ethnicity is also important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While Honeywells Corporate Governance Guidelines do not prescribe a diversity policy or standards, as a matter of practice, the Corporate Governance and Responsibility Committee is committed to enhancing both the diversity of the Board itself and the perspectives and values that are discussed in Board and Committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our current Board composition reflects this approach and the Boards commitment to diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION SNAPSHOT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowner Engagement on Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During our 2016 Summer/Fall shareowner outreach, we received positive feedback on our financial performance, our strong leadership team and the Boards approach to succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our shareowners suggested several ways in which we could modify our compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are making changes to our compensation program in response to shareowner feedback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These changes reflect our Boards recognition that there should be a more visible linkage of compensation to business results and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table summarizes the modifications we have made or intend to make and provides a timeline for how our compensation programs will evolve.

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement is being provided to shareowners in connection with the solicitation of proxies by the Board of Directors for use at the Annual Meeting of Shareowners of Honeywell International Inc. (Honeywell or the Company) to be held on Monday, April 24, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 1: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywells directors are elected at each Annual Meeting of Shareowners and hold office for one-year terms or until their successors are duly elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywells By-laws provide that in any uncontested election of directors (an election in which the number of nominees does not exceed the number of directors to be elected), any nominee who receives a greater number of votes cast FOR his or her election than votes cast AGAINST his or her election will be elected to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has nominated 13 candidates for election as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any nominee should become unavailable to serve prior to the Annual Meeting, the shares represented by a properly signed and returned proxy card or voted by telephone, via the Internet or by scanning the QR code will be voted for the election of such other person as may be designated by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board may also determine to leave the vacancy temporarily unfilled or reduce the authorized number of directors in accordance with the By-laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors may serve until the Annual Meeting of Shareowners immediately following their 72nd birthday
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR NOMINATIONS  SKILLS AND CRITERIA
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance and Responsibility Committee (CGRC) is responsible for nominating a slate of director nominees who collectively have the complementary experience, qualifications, skills and attributes to guide the Company and function effectively as a Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CGRC believes that each of the nominees has key personal attributes that are important to an effective board: integrity, candor, analytical skills, the willingness to engage management and each other in a constructive and collaborative fashion, and the ability and commitment to devote significant time and energy to service on the Board and its Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following list highlights other key experiences, qualifications and skills of our director nominees that are relevant and important in light of Honeywells businesses and structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017     |     Proxy and Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareowners
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 1: Election of Directors > Director Nominations  Skills and Criteria
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS CRITERIA
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior Leadership Experience
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experience serving as CEO or a senior executive provides a practical understanding of how complex organizations like Honeywell function and hands-on leadership experience in core management areas, such as strategic and operational planning, financial reporting, compliance, risk management and leadership development.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Industry/Global Experience
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experience in industries, end-markets and growth segments that Honeywell serves, such as aerospace, automotive, construction, transportation, infrastructure, oil and gas, security and fire, energy efficiency and worker productivity and safety as well as the global markets in which we operate, enables a better understanding of the issues facing our businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial Expertise
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that an understanding of finance and financial reporting processes is important for our directors to monitor and assess the Companys operating and strategic performance and to ensure accurate financial reporting and robust controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our director nominees have relevant background and experience in capital markets, corporate finance, accounting and financial reporting and several satisfy the accounting or related financial management expertise criteria set forth in the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regulated Industries/Government Experience
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell is subject to a broad array of government regulations and demand for its products and services can be impacted by changes in law or regulation in areas such as safety, security and energy efficiency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Several of our directors have experience in regulated industries, providing them with nsight and perspective in working constructively and proactively with governments and agencies globally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Public Company Board Experience
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Service on the boards and board committees of other public companies provides an understanding of corporate governance practices and trends and insights into board management, relations between the board, the CEO and senior management, agenda setting and succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of the Boards role in risk oversight and our robust enterprise risk management program, we seek directors who can help manage and mitigate key risks, including cybersecurity, regulatory compliance, competition, financial, brand integrity and intellectual property.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Innovation and Technology
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell is committed to strong corporate governance policies, practices and procedures designed to make the Board more effective in exercising its oversight role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following sections provide an overview of our corporate governance structure, including the independence and other criteria we use in selecting director nominees, our Board leadership structure, and the responsibilities of the Board and each of its Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines, among other key governance materials, help guide our Board and management in the performance of their duties and are regularly reviewed by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our outreach to shareowners on a variety of corporate governance-related topics is also discussed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KEY CORPORATE GOVERNANCE DOCUMENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please visit our website at www.honeywell.com (see Investors/Corporate Governance) to view the following documents:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Business Conduct
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Committees and Charters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Charter and By-laws of Honeywell
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These documents are available free of charge on our website or by writing to Honeywell, 115 Tabor Road, Morris Plains, New Jersey 07950, c/o Vice President and Corporate Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywells Code of Business Conduct applies to all directors, officers (including the Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer and Controller) and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amendments to or waivers of the Code of Business Conduct granted to any of Honeywells directors and executive officers will be published on our website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary functions of Honeywells Board of Directors are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To oversee management performance on behalf of shareowners;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure that the long-term interests of the shareowners are being served;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To monitor adherence to Honeywell standards and policies;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To promote the exercise of responsible corporate citizenship; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To perform the duties and responsibilities assigned to the Board by the laws of Delaware, Honeywells state of incorporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors held twelve meetings during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The average attendance at meetings of the Board and Board Committees during 2016 was 98%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During this period, all of the directors attended or participated in at least 75% of the aggregate of the total number of meetings of the Board of Directors and the total number of meetings held by all Committees of the Board of Directors on which each such director served.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In June 2016, we announced that David Cote would step down as CEO on March 31, 2017 and serve as Chairman until the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Darius Adamczyk, the current President and Chief Operating Officer and a member of the Board, will become CEO on March 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywells Corporate Governance Guidelines do not establish a fixed rule as to whether the offices of Chairman and CEO should be vested in the same person or two different people, but rather specify that board leadership structure is best considered as part of the CEO succession planning process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to Mr. Cotes retirement as Chairman of the Board in April 2018, the Board will determine whether to reinstate a combined CEO/Chairman role or separate them and appoint an independent Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes that the continuation of Mr. Cotes service as Chairman of the Board until April 2018 is in the best interest of the Company and its shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cote possesses detailed and in-depth knowledge of the issues, opportunities and challenges facing the Company and its businesses and is well positioned to facilitate a seamless transition to new leadership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has been actively engaged in the implementation of the CEO succession plan and is focused on ensuring a successful CEO transition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A smooth transition is critical for maintaining a well-functioning company while building on a stellar track record of performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cote, as Chairman, is well positioned to provide leadership continuity as well as advice and guidance to Mr. Adamczyk and the Board during the leadership transition period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In June 2016, in addition to announcing the CEO transition from Mr. Cote to Mr. Adamczyk, we also took steps to strengthen the Lead Director role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most importantly, instead of rotating lead directors annually based on seniority, the Board extended the tenure of the Lead Director to two years and made selection of the Lead Director a matter voted on by the Board using formal selection criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also expanded the responsibilities of the Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See chart below for the selection criteria and the enhanced duties and responsibilities of the Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the selection criteria, the Board elected Mr. Jaime Chico Pardo as the Lead Director to serve through the April 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board elected Mr. Chico Pardo because, in the opinion of the Board, he best meets the Lead Director selection criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Practices and Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards CommitteesAudit, Corporate Governance and Responsibility, Management Development and Compensation, and Retirement Plans undertake extensive analysis and review of the Companys activities in key areas such as financial reporting, risk management, internal controls, compliance, corporate governance, succession planning and executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and its Committees perform an annual review of the agenda and topics to be considered for each meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During that review, each Board and Committee member is free to raise topics that are not on the agenda at any meeting and to suggest items for inclusion on future agendas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director is provided in advance written material to be considered at every meeting of the Board and has the opportunity to provide comments an suggestions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and its Committees provide feedback to management, and management is required to answer questions raised by the directors during Board and Committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the Lead Director and the Chair of the Corporate Governance and Responsibility Committee is permanently empowered and authorized to call special meetings of the Board at any time and for any reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Committee Oversight of Independent Accountants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee seeks to ensure the exercise of appropriate professional skepticism by the independent accountants by reviewing and discussing, among other things, management and auditor reports regarding significant estimates and judgments and the results of peer quality review and PCAOB inspections of the independent accountants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They also review and pre-approve all audit and non-audit services provided to Honeywell by the independent accountants in order to determine that such services would not adversely impact auditor independence and objectivity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also holds separate executive sessions at each in-person meeting with representatives of our independent accountants, and with Honeywells Chief Financial Officer and Vice PresidentCorporate Audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that Messrs. Paz, Burke, and Davis, and Mses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deily and Washington satisfy the accounting or related financial management expertise requirements set forth in the NYSE listing standards, and has designated each of Mr. Paz, Mr. Davis and Ms. Washington as the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) defined audit committee financial expert.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See page 78 for the Audit Committee Report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Committee Retention of the Outside Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Management Development and Compensation Committee (MDCC) has sole authority to retain a compensation consultant to assist the MDCC in the evaluation of director, CEO or senior executive compensation, but only after considering all factors relevant to the consultants independence from management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the MDCC is directly responsible for approving the consultants compensation, evaluating its performance, and terminating its engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the MDCCs established policy, its consultant cannot provide any other services to Honeywell.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since October 2009, the MDCC has retained Pearl Meyer (PM) as its independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC regularly reviews the services provided by its outside consultants and performs an annual assessment of the independence of its compensation consultant to determine whether the compensation consultant is independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC conducted a specific review of its relationship with PM in 2016, and determined that PM is independent in providing Honeywell with executive compensation consulting services and that PMs work for the MDCC did not raise any conflicts of interest, consistent with SEC rules and NYSE listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making this determination, the MDCC reviewed information provided by PM on the following factors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any other services provided to Honeywell by PM;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fees received by PM from Honeywell as a percentage of PMs total revenue;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policies or procedures maintained by PM to prevent a conflict of interest;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any business or personal relationship between the individual PM consultants assigned to the Honeywell relationship and any MDCC memb
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any business or personal relationship between the individual PM consultants assigned to the Honeywell relationship, or PM itself, and Honeywells executive officers; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Honeywell stock owned by PM or the individual PM consultants assigned to the Honeywell relationship.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the MDCC noted that PM did not provide any services to the Company or its management other than service to the MDCC, and its services were limited to executive compensation consulting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, it does not provide, directly or indirectly through affiliates, any non-executive compensation services, including, but not limited to, pension consulting or human resources outsourcing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC will continue to monitor the independence of its compensation consultant on a periodic basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PM compiles information and provides advice regarding the components and mix (short-term/long-term; fixed/variable; cash/equity) of the executive compensation programs of Honeywell and its Compensation Peer Group (see pages 40-41 of this proxy statement for further detail regarding the Compensation Peer Group) and analyzes the relative performance of Honeywell and the Compensation Peer Group with respect to stock performance and the financial metrics generally used in the programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PM also provides information regarding emerging trends and best practices in executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to information compiled by PM, the MDCC also reviews general survey data compiled and published by third parties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither the MDCC nor Honeywell has any input into the scope of or the companies included in these third-party surveys.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the MDCC reviews information provided by PM regarding compensation paid by the Compensation Peer Group, as well as third-party survey data as a general indicator of relevant market conditions, the MDCC does not target a specific competitive position relative to the market in making its compensation determination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PM reports to the MDCC Chair, has direct access to MDCC members, attends MDCC meetings either in person or by telephone, and meets with the MDCC in executive session without management present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance > Boards Role in Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Input From Senior Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC considers input from senior management in making determinations regarding the overall executive compensation program and the individual compensation of the executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of Honeywells annual planning process, the CEO, CFO and Senior Vice President-Human Resources, Procurement and Communications develop targets for Honeywells incentive compensation programs and present them to the MDCC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These targets are reviewed by the MDCC to ensure alignment with our strategic and annual operating plans, taking into account the targeted year-over-year and multi-year improvements as well as dentified opportunities and risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO recommends base salary adjustments and cash and equity incentive award levels for Honeywells other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These recommendations are based on performance appraisals (including an assessment of the achievement of pre-established inancial and non-financial management objectives) together with a review of supplemental performance measures and prior compensation levels elative to performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the CEO presents to the MDCC and the full Board his evaluation of each executive officers contribution and performance over the past year, strengths and development needs and actions, and reviews succession plans for each of the executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARDS ROLE IN RISK OVERSIGHT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While senior management has primary responsibility for managing risk, the Board as a whole has responsibility for risk oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Relevant Board Committees review specific risk areas, as enumerated below, and report on their deliberations to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The full Board oversees risk in several ways.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through regular updates on the financial and operating results of Honeywell, as well as the annual operating and five-year strategic plans of each Strategic Business Unit (SBG), management provides the Board with managements view of the key commercial and strategic risks faced by each business unit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During those presentations, the Board is able to provide management with feedback on whether management has identified the key risks and is taking appropriate actions to mitigate risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, management reports to the Board and each Committee periodically on specific, material risks as they arise or as requested by individual Board members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually, management reports to the Audit Committee and full Board on its Enterprise Risk Management or ERM program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These presentations are designed to provide full visibility into the risks facing Honeywell and how management is mitigating risk, thereby enabling the Board to effectively exercise its oversight function.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through its ERM program, management identifies the most significant risks facing the Company and ensures that, where possible, it deploys adequate risk mitigation strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through dialogue with the Board as a whole and individual Board members, the Board provides oversight and guidance to management to ensure that the ERM process identifies the complete universe of risks facing Honeywell and that adequate mitigation steps, where appropriate, are in place.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n 2015, each Board member was interviewed by management to solicit feedback on Honeywells ERM process to ensure that the universe of risks and how management ranked those risks in terms of likelihood of occurrence and financial impact were appropriate and realistic.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Feedback from the one-on- one interviews with each Board member was presented to the full Board and incorporated in our ERM program and risk mitigation efforts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The specific risk areas of focus for the Board and each of its Committees are summarized below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee and the MDCC meet n executive session with key management personnel (for example, the Vice President-Corporate Audit meets in executive session with the Audit Committee) and in certain instances representatives of outside advisors (for example, the Audit Committee regularly meets in executive session with the Companys independent auditors).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board/Committee Primary Areas of Risk Oversight Full Board    General commercial risks such as new product launch, capital spend, raw material price increases, foreign currency fluctuation, diminished customer demand, technology obsolescence, reductions to government spending, and a slowdown in economic growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the Presidents and CEOs of our SBGs reviews these risks as part of his annual strategic review with the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: M&A integration and the M&A competitive landscape    Legal risks arising from litigation, intellectual property infringement, health, safety, and environment, regulatory issues such as Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA), antitrust, conflict minerals, and product liability    Cybersecurity including protection of customer and employee data, trade secrets and other proprietary crown jewel information, ensuring the security of data on the cloud, persistent threats, and cyber risks associated with our own software products
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines state that the Board intends that, at all times, a substantial majority of its directors will be considered independent under relevant NYSE and SEC guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance and Responsibility Committee conducts an annual review of the independence of the directors and reports its findings to the full Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the report and recommendation of the Corporate Governance and Responsibility Committee, the Board has determined that each of the non- employee nominees standing for election to the Board at the Annual MeetingMessrs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ayer, Burke, Chico Pardo, Davis, Gregg, Hollick, Paz, and Sheares and Mses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deily, Lieblein and Washingtonsatisfies the independence criteria in the applicable NYSE listing standards and SEC rules (including the enhanced criteria with respect to members of the Audit Committee and the MDCC).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Board Committee member qualifies as a non- employee director within the meaning of Rule 16b-3 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the Exchange Act).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a director to be considered independent, the Board must determine that the director does not have any material relationships with Honeywell, eithe directly as a partner, shareowner or officer of an organization that has a relationship with Honeywell, other than as a director and shareowner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Material relationships can include vendor, supplier, consulting, legal, banking, accounting, charitable and family relationships, among others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Criteria for Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board considered all relevant facts and circumstances in making its determinations, including the following
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No non-employee director or nominee receives any direct compensation from Honeywell other than under the director compensation program described on pages 16-19 of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No immediate family member (within the meaning of the NYSE listing standards) of any non-employee director or nominee is an employee of Honeywell or otherwise receives direct compensation from Honeywell.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No non-employee director or nominee is affiliated with Honeywell or any of its subsidiaries or affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No non-employee director or nominee is an employee of Honeywells independent accountants and no non-employee director or nominee (or any of their respective immediate family members) is a current partner of Honeywells independent accountants, or was within the last three years, a partner or employee of Honeywells independent accountants and personally worked on Honeywells audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No non-employee director or nominee is a member, partner, or principal of any law firm, accounting firm or investment banking firm that receives any consulting, advisory or other fees from Honeywell.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Honeywell executive officer is on the compensation committee of the board of directors of a company that employs any of our non-employee directors or nominees (or any of their respective immediate family members) as an executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No non-employee director or nominee (or any of their respective immediate family members) is indebted to Honeywell, nor is Honeywell indebted to any non-employee director or nominee (or any of their respective immediate family members).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No non-employee director or nominee serves as an executive officer of a charitable or other tax-exempt organization that received contributions from Honeywell.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell has commercial relationships (purchase and/or sale of products and services) with companies at which our directors serve or have served as officers (Mr. AyerAlaska Air Group, Mr. BurkeConsolidated Edison, Mr. DavisUPS, Ms. LiebleinGeneral Motors, Mr. PazExpress Scripts and Ms. WashingtonGilead Sciences).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In each case:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IDENTIFICATION AND EVALUATION OF DIRECTOR CANDIDATES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance and Responsibility Committee (CGRC) also serves as the Boards Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CGRC consists entirely of independent directors under applicable SEC rules and NYSE listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this role, they seek individuals qualified to become directors, evaluate the qualifications of individuals suggested or nominated by third parties, including shareowners (and recommend actions if needed), and recommend to the Board the nominees to be proposed by Honeywell for election to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CGRC considers director candidates in anticipation of upcoming director elections and other potential or expected Board vacancies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CGRC considers director candidates suggested by its members, other directors, senior management and shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CGRC has, from time to time, retained, at Honeywells expense, a search firm to identify potential director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CGRC is also authorized to retain other external advisors for specific purposes, including performing background reviews of potential candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The search firm retained by the CGRC has been provided guidance as to the particular experience, skills and other characteristics that the Board is seeking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CGRC has delegated responsibility for day-to-day management and oversight of the search firm engagement to Honeywells Senior Vice PresidentHuman Resources, Procurement and Communications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Preliminary interviews of director candidates are conducted by either the Chairman of the CGRC or, at his or her request, any other member of the CGRC, the Chairman of the Board and/or a representative of the retained search firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Background material about the director candidates is distributed to the CGRC members for their review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director candidates that are determined to merit further consideration are interviewed by other CGRC members, directors and key senior management personnel as determined by the CGRC Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CGRC then considers these interview results in its deliberations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CGRC annually reviews with the Board the requisite skills and characteristics of Board members, as well as the composition of the Board as a whole.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This assessment includes a consideration of independence, diversity, age, skills, experience and industry backgrounds in the context of the needs of the Board and the Company, as well as the ability of current and prospective directors to devote sufficient time to performing their duties in an effective manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are expected to exemplify the highest standards of personal and professional integrity, and to constructively challenge management through their active participation and questioning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the CGRC seeks directors with established strong professional reputations and expertise in areas relevant to the strategy and operations of Honeywells businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CGRC conducts regular reviews of current directors in light of the considerations described above and past contributions to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OUR COMMITMENT TO BOARD DIVERSITY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While Honeywells Corporate Governance Guidelines do not prescribe a diversity policy or standards, as a matter of practice, the CGRC is committed to enhancing both the diversity of the Board itself and the perspectives and values that are discussed in Board and Committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our current Board composition reflects this approach and the Boards commitment to diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD TENURE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that electing directors with a mix of tenures facilitates effective Board oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hence, careful consideration is made to achieve the appropriate balance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors with many years of service to Honeywell provide the Board with a deep knowledge of our Company, while newer directors lend fresh perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowners wishing to recommend a director candidate to the CGRC for its consideration should write to the CGRC, in care of Vice President and Corporate Secretary, Honeywell, 115 Tabor Road, Morris Plains, New Jersey 07950.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To receive meaningful consideration, a recommendation should include the candidates name, biographical data, and a description of his or her qualifications in light of the above criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowners wishing to nominate a director should follow the procedures set forth in the Companys By-laws and described under Director Nominations on page 88 of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This year, one director is proposed for nomination to the Board of Directors that has not previously been nominated for election to the Board by the shareowners, Mr. Darius Adamczyk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Adamczyk was elected to the Board by its directors effective December 9, 2016 and will succeed Mr. Cote as Honeywells CEO on March 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Adamczyk is currently Honeywells President and Chief Operating Officer, a position he will continue to hold until he succeeds Mr. Cote as CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Adamczyk will not serve on any of the Committees of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell did not receive any recommendation of a director candidate from a shareowner, or group of shareowners, that beneficially owned more than 3% of Honeywells common stock (Common Stock) for at least three years as of the date of recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR ORIENTATION AND CONTINUING EDUCATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of Honeywells director orientation program, new directors participate in one-on-one introductory meetings with Honeywell business and functional leaders and are given presentations by members of senior management on Honeywells strategic plans, financial statements and key issues, policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors may enroll in director continuing education programs at Honeywells expense on corporate governance and critical issues associated with a directors service on a public company board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our senior management meets regularly with the Board and meets annually to review with the Board the operating plan of the Company and each of our SBGs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also periodically participates in site visits to Honeywells facilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR ATTENDANCE AT ANNUAL MEETINGS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell has no specific policy regarding director attendance at its Annual Meeting of Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, however, Board and Committee meetings are held immediately preceding and following the Annual Meeting of Shareowners, with directors attending the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the directors attended last years Annual Meeting of Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CGRC reviews and makes recommendations to the Board regarding the form and amount of compensation for non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors who are employees of Honeywell receive no compensation for service on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywells director compensation program is designed to enable continued attraction and retention of highly qualified directors and is designed to address the time, effort, expertise and accountability required of active Board membership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, the CGRC and the Board believe that annual compensation for non-employee directors should consist of both a cash component, designed to compensate members for their service on the Board and its Committees, and an equity component, designed to align the interests of directors and shareowners and, by vesting over time, to create an incentive for continued service on the Board.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A non-employee director may elect to defer all or any portion of his or her annual cash retainers and fees, until a specified calendar year or termination of Board service.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts credited either accrue interest (3.64% for 2016) or are valued as if invested in a Honeywell Common Stock fund or one of the other funds available to participants in our employee savings plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The unit price of the Honeywell Common Stock fund is increased to take dividends into account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to payments at the termination of Board service, upon a change of control, as defined in the Non-Employee Director Plan, a director may receive, pursuant to a prior election, a lump-sum payment for amounts deferred before 2006.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors are also provided with $350,000 in business travel accident insurance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They are also eligible to elect to receive $100,000 in term life insurance and medical and dental coverage, for themselves and their eligible dependents, which is consistent with similar coverage offered to Honeywells active salaried employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors elected to the Board after September 2008 are responsible for paying premiums for term life insurance and medical and dental coverage which they elect to receive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell also matches, dollar for dollar, any charitable contribution made by a director to any charity, up to a maximum of $25,000 in the aggregate per director, per calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, directors may utilize available Company aircraft for travel to and from Board and Committee meetings.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director stock ownership guidelines have been adopted under which each non-employee director, while serving as a director of Honeywell, must hold Common Stock (including restricted shares and RSUs and/or Common Stock equivalents) with a market value of at least five times the annual cash retainer (or $500,000).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They must hold net gain shares from option exercises for one year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net gain shares means the number of shares obtained by exercising the option, less the number of shares the director sells to cover the exercise price of the options and pay applicable taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors have five years from election to the Board to attain the prescribed ownership threshold.

sentences.text: CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED TRANSACTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Applicable Policies and Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell has written policies and procedures for approval or ratification of related person transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Article EIGHTH of Honeywells Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation provides that a related or interested party transaction shall not be void or voidable if such transaction is duly authorized or ratified by a majority of the disinterested members of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with SEC rules, a related or interested party transaction includes a transaction between the Company and a director, director nominee or executive officer of the Company or a beneficial owner of more than 5% of the Companys Common Stock or any of their respective immediate family members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, the Honeywell Code of Business Conduct requires that each director and executive officer report to the Board of Directors on an ongoing basis any relationship or transaction that may create or appear to create a conflict between the personal interests of those individuals (or their immediate family members) and the interests of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A conflict, or appearance of a conflict, might arise, for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017     |     Proxy and Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareowners
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Information > Five Percent Owners of Company Stock
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: example, by accepting gifts or loans from a current or potential customer, supplier or competitor, owning a financial interest in, or serving in a business capacity with, an outside enterprise that competes with or does or wishes to do business with, the Company, serving as an intermediary for the benefit of a third party in transactions involving the Company or using confidential Company information or other corporate assets for personal profit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a conflict of interest or related party transaction is of a type or a nature that falls within the scope of oversight of a particular Board Committee, it is referred to that Committee for review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board or the responsible Committee must review any potential conflict and determine whether any action is required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This includes whether to authorize, ratify or direct the unwinding of the relationship or transaction under consideration, as well as ensure that appropriate controls are in place to protect Honeywell and its shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making that determination, the Board or responsible Committee considers all relevant facts and circumstances, such as:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits of the transaction to Honeywell;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of the transaction and whether they are arms-length and in the ordinary course of the Companys business;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The direct or indirect nature of the related persons interest in the transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The size and expected term of the transaction; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other facts and circumstances that bear on the materiality of the related person transaction under applicable law and listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director and officer also completes and signs a questionnaire at the end of each fiscal year to confirm that there are no material relationships or related person transactions between such individuals and the Company other than those previously disclosed to Honeywell.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This ensures that all material relationships and related person transactions are identified, reviewed and disclosed in accordance with applicable policies, procedures and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SUSTAINABILITY AND CORPORATE RESPONSIBILITY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell takes seriously its commitment to corporate social responsibility, protection of our environment, and creation of Sustainable Opportunity everywhere it operates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywells Sustainable Opportunity policy is based on the principle that by integrating health, safety, and environmental considerations into all aspects of its business, Honeywell:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Protects its people and the environment;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achieves sustainable growth and accelerated productivity;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Drives compliance with all applicable regulations; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Develops the technologies that expand the sustainable capacity of our world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nearly 50% of Honeywells product portfolio is linked to energy efficiency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017     |     Proxy and Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareowners
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sustainability and Corporate Responsibility > Highlights of Our Environmental and Safety Goals and Achievement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HIGHLIGHTS OF OUR ENVIRONMENTAL AND SAFETY GOALS AND ACHIEVEMENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Greenhouse Gas Reduction and Energy Efficiency
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2007, the Company established five-year greenhouse gas and energy efficiency objectives for its internal operations for the period 2007-2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell reports on its global greenhouse gas emissions publicly through the Carbon Disclosure Project and through reports submitted to the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and the United Kingdom Environmental Agency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A qualified third party has verified Honeywells 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014 and 2015 greenhouse gas emission inventories.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By the end of 2011, Honeywell had reduced its greenhouse gas emissions by more than 30%, and increased its energy efficiency by more than 20%, in each case, from a 2004 baseline year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To sustain this progress, Honeywell set an additional public commitment to reduce its greenhouse gas emissions per dollar of revenue from our 2011 level by an additional 15% by 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We met this goal three years early and, in 2015, set an additional goal at an event at the U.S. Department of Energy: by 2019 Honeywell will reduce its greenhouse gas emissions per dollar of revenue from our 2013 level by an additional 10%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2013, the Company implemented water conservation projects at sites that are significant water consumers in areas that are experiencing water stress as defined by the World Resources Institute.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Water
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell has developed a global inventory of water usage in its manufacturing operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company implemented additional water conservation projects in these areas in 2014, 2015 and 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain a Company-wide global Total Case Incident Rate (the number of occupational injuries and illnesses per 100 employees) of less than half of the combined U.S. averages of the industries in which we operate, based on data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Safety
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell utilizes a comprehensive Health, Safety, Environment, Product Stewardship and Sustainability (HSEPS) Management System based on recognized third-party standards, including ISO 14001 and OHSAS 18001, and industry best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The management system is fully integrated into the Honeywell Operating System, which drives continuous sustainable operational improvement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compliance with standards and regulatory requirements is monitored through a Company-wide, HSEPS-led audit process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The timely development and implementation of process improvements and corrective action plans are closely monitored.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell has received worker safety awards from governments and organizations around the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Health, Safety, Environment, Product Stewardship and Sustainability Management System
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywells Health, Safety, Environment, Product Stewardship and Sustainability matters are managed by a global team of trained professionals with extensive knowledge and hundreds of years of collective experience in occupational health, chemistry, hydrology, geology, engineering, safety, industrial hygiene, materials management and energy efficiency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywells Vice President of HSEPS reports to the Companys Senior Vice President and General Counsel and has overall responsibility for HSEPS programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A Corporate Energy & Sustainability Team, led by the Vice President of HSEPS, the Vice President of Global Real Estate and the Director of Sustainability, helps drive the Companys sustainability goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Progress on these goals is reported to Honeywells CEO on a monthly basis and is reviewed with the Boards Corporate Governance and Responsibility Committee at least annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy and Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareowners     |     2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Political Contributions and Activities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywells Integrity and Compliance program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywells Integrity and Compliance program reflects our vision and values and helps our employees, representatives, contractors, consultants, and suppliers comply with a high standard of business conduct globally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the core of the Integrity and Compliance program is the Companys Code of Business Conduct (the Code) that applies across the Company in all businesses and in all countries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All employees are required to complete Code of Business Conduct training and certify that they will comply with the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, managers and executives certify on an annual basis that they will act in accordance with the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code is a baseline set of requirements that enables employees to recognize and be aware of how to report integrity, compliance, and legal issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Code outlines our pledge to recognize the dignity of each individual, respect each employee, provide compensation and benefits that are competitive, promote self-development through training that broadens work-related skills, and value diversity of perspectives and ideas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code provides guidance and outlines expectations in a number of key integrity and compliance areas, including how employees should treat each other, conflicts of interest, HSEPS, books and records, anti-corruption and proper business practices, trade compliance, insider trading, data privacy, respect for human rights, and the appropriate use of information technology and social media.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the Code, Honeywells Integrity and Compliance program provides comprehensive training on key compliance topics, develops training scenarios, provides mechanisms for employees and third parties to report concerns, and ensures timely and fair reviews of integrity and compliance concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell Hometown Solutions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell demonstrates its commitment to corporate social responsibility and community involvement through Honeywell Hometown Solutions, which ocuses on five important societal needs that align with Honeywells culture, products and people: safety and security, housing and shelter, math and science education, habitat and conservation, and humanitarian relief.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These programs have delivered significant and meaningful results in communities around the world, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Teaching parents and children potentially life-saving lessons to help avoid abduction and preventable childhood injuries;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Repairing homes and community centers for low-income families, the elderly and the disabled
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Offering academic opportunities that inspire students to pursue careers in science, technology, engineering and math (STEM), and providing teache with new and innovative techniques to teach STEM education;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Partnering with environmental organizations to provide students with unique learning opportunities and teaching tools for educators to promote environmental science in the classroom; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Helping Honeywell employees and communities recover from natural disasters such as Hurricanes Matthew and Sandy along the eastern seaboard of the U.S., wildfires in Alberta, Canada, and Colorado Springs, flooding in Louisiana, Super Typhoon Haiyan in the Philippines, the Great Japan Earthquake and Tsunami, and earthquakes in Mexico, Haiti and China.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information about our sustainability and corporate citizenship programs, please visit our website at www.honeywell.com, and Corporate Citizenship at http://citizenship.honeywell.com/.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: POLITICAL CONTRIBUTIONS AND ACTIVITIES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Engagement in the political process is critical to our success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our future growth depends on forward-thinking legislation and regulation that makes society safer and more energy efficient and improves public infrastructure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We strive to always engage responsibly in the political process and to ensure that our participation is fully consistent with all applicable laws and regulations, our principles of good governance, and our high standards of ethical conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have developed a strong team of government relations professionals based in Washington, D.C. that drive our lobbying programs and initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our government relations organization is led by a Senior Vice President, Global Government Relations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of the government relations organization work from a global network of offices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MANAGEMENT AND BOARD OVERSIGHT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The law department oversees our lobbying activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Senior Vice President, Global Government Relations reports to the Companys Senior Vice President and General Counsel (General Counsel) and also works closely with the Vice President, Global Compliance whose organization ensures compliance with our political spending policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The General Counsel, Senior Vice President, Global Government Relations and Vice President, Global Compliance meet regularly with the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer and his leadership team about legislative, regulatory and political developments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to Board of Directors oversight, our public policy efforts, including all lobbying activities, political contributions and payments to trade associations and other tax-exempt organizations, is the responsibility of the Corporate Governance and Responsibility Committee (CGRC), which consists entirely of independent, non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year the CGRC receives an annual report on the Companys policies and practices egarding political contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CGRCs oversight of our political activities ensures compliance with applicable law and alignment with our policies and our Code of Business Conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each year the Senior Vice President, Global Government Relations reports to the full Board of Directors on our global lobbying and government relations program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: POLITICAL CONTRIBUTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have not made any political contributions using corporate funds since at least 2009 and have no present intention of making such political contributions in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even before 2009, any such contributions were extremely rare and for minimal amounts of less than $5,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2013, we revised and expanded our disclosure on our policy and procedures for political activity and contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This disclosure is available on Honeywells website at www.honeywell.com (see Investors/Corporate Governance/Political Contributions).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Center for Political Accountability (CPA), a non-profit, non-partisan organization, assessed our disclosure for its annual CPA-Zicklin Index of Corporate Political Disclosure and Accountability (CPA-Zicklin Index).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CPA-Zicklin Index measures the transparency, policies, and practices of the S&P 500.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our enhanced disclosure on political lobbying and contributions ranked us in the First Tier of the 2016 CPA-Zicklin Index for the third year in a row.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our enhanced disclosure was also influenced by feedback received from our largest shareowners during our shareowner outreach initiative where we met with shareowners to discuss their views on several topics, including Honeywells disclosure on lobbying and political contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional detail on Honeywells policies and processes on political contributions and lobbying, please see our response to Shareowner Proposal Number 6 on pages 82-84.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SHAREOWNER OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Understanding the issues that are important to our shareowners is critical in ensuring that we address their interests in a meaningful and effective way.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is also a tenet of good governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In that light, we engage with our shareowners on a regular basis to discuss a range of topics including our performance, strategy, risk management, executive compensation, and corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recognize the value of taking our shareowners views into account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dialogue and engagement with our shareowners helps us understand how they view us, set goals and expectations for our performance, and identify emerging issues that may affect our strategies, corporate governance, compensation practices or other aspects of our operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our shareowner and investor outreach includes investor road shows, analyst meetings, and investor conferences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also communicate with shareowners and other stakeholders through various media, including our annual report and SEC filings, proxy statement, news releases, and our website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We hold conference calls for our quarterly earnings releases and other major corporate events which are open to all.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These calls are available in real time and as archived webcasts on our website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Chairman and CEO, Chief Operating Officer, Chief Financial Officer, Vice President of Investor Relations and other senior management meet periodically with investors to discuss Honeywells strategy, financial and business performance and to update investors on key developments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Lead Director and the Chair of the Management Development and Compensation Committee met with a significant number of our largest shareowners in 2016 o discuss a range of issues including executive compensation and corporate governance.

sentences.text: Executive Compensation > Proposal No. 2: Advisory Vote on the Frequency of Future Advisory Votes to Approve Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 2: ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF FUTURE ADVISORY VOTES TO APPROVE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are seeking a non-binding vote from our shareowners as to the frequency with which shareowners should have an opportunity to provide an advisory approval of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Dodd-Frank Act, every six years the Company is required to seek a non-binding advisory shareowner vote regarding the frequency of the submission to shareowners of an advisory vote to approve executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Dodd-Frank Act specifies that shareowners be given the opportunity to vote on executive compensation every one, two or three years or abstain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the reasons described below, we recommend that our shareowners select a frequency of one year (i.e., annually).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Starting with our annual meeting held in 2011, we have held annual votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that an annual advisory vote on executive compensation is consistent with having a regular dialogue with our shareowners on corporate governance matters, including executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An annual shareowner vote allows our shareowners to provide us with direct and immediate feedback regarding the effectiveness of our compensation programs, and provides our Board and compensation committee with the opportunity to consider shareowner views as part of its regular compensation review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We therefore request that our shareowners select 1 Year when voting on the frequency of advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the advisory vote is non-binding, our Board will review the results of the vote and, consistent with our record of shareowner engagement, take them into account in making a determination concerning the frequency of advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your Board of Directors unanimously recommends a vote for the option of 1 Year on the frequency of future advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 3: ADVISORY VOTE TO APPROVE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell seeks a non-binding advisory vote from its shareowners to approve the compensation of its Named Executive Officers as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section beginning on page 26 and the Compensation Tables section beginning on page 60.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This vote is commonly known as Say-on-Pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have made some significant modifications to our compensation programs in part as a result of feedback we received from our shareowners after our 2016 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to read the Compensation Discussion and Analysis and Compensation Table sections to learn more about our executive compensation programs and policies and the changes we are making.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that its 2016 compensation decisions and our executive compensation programs align the interests of shareowners and executives by emphasizing variable, at-risk compensation largely tied to measurable performance goals utilizing an appropriate balance of near-term and long-term objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This vote is not intended to address a specific item of compensation, but rather our overall compensation policies and procedures related to the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the Say-on-Pay vote is advisory, it will not be binding upon the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Board will take into account the outcome of the vote and discussions with investors when considering future executive compensation arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted a policy of providing for an annual Say-on-Pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required by the executive compensation rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission, in Proposal 2 of this proxy statement, we are requesting that shareowners vote on the frequency of the Say-on-Pay vote and recommend that shareowners continue to support an annual Say-on-Pay vote to approve executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends that shareowners vote in favor of the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the Companys shareowners approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the Named Executive Officers, as disclosed in the Companys proxy statement for the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareowners pursuant to the executive compensation disclosure rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the 2016 Summary Compensation Table and the other related tables and disclosure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your Board of Directors unanimously recommends a vote FOR this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
