sentences.text: EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Honeywell once again successfully balanced short-term financial performance and long-term value creation for our shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In terms of comparing our 2016 financial results to our compensation peer group:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We grew reported revenue 1.9%, whereas median reported revenues among our compensation peer group declined 0.9%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our net income(1) increased 6.4%, whereas the median net income among our compensation peer group increased only 2.0%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We grew EPS(1) 8.2%, whereas median adjusted EPS growth among our compensation peer group was only 7.4% (despite the fact that compensation peers were more aggressive in their use of share repurchases) and we incurred the following expenses and costs during 2016 that negatively impacted 2016 EPS but which represent investments that create long-term value for our shareowners:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: $0.24 per share of commercial aerospace original equipment manufacturers (OEM) incentive payments by our Aerospace (Aero) Strategic Business Group (SBG) to secure our position on key air transport and business jet platforms;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: $0.22 per share of acquisition related amortization expense and integration costs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: $0.28 per share representing increased R&D expenditures;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: $0.09 per share representing increased repositioning expenses that will make our operations more efficient and productive and which we estimate will reduce costs annually by $200-$300 million once fully implemented; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: $0.05 per share representing increased depreciation largely attributable to significant capital expenditure investment in high return on investment (ROI) projects such as Solstice refrigerant and UOP catalyst manufacturing capacity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016 we continued executing on a balanced capital deployment strategy by repurchasing $2.1 billion of our shares, restructuring and refinancing over $8 billion in debt, increasing our dividend rate by 12% and funding high ROI capital projects through $1.1 billion in capital expenditures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was also notable in terms of the number of transformational events and transactions that will ensure the sustainability of our annual financial performance:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We undertook a significant reorganization of our SBGs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to better drive top-line growth through customer focus and technological innovation and improve the overall speed of decision-making in the organization, we separated our former Automation and Control Solutions (ACS) SBG into two new SBGs: Home and Building Technologies (HBT) and Safety and Productivity Solutions (SPS).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Going forward, we will operate out of four SBGs: Aero, HBT, Performance Materials and Technologies (PMT) and SPS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors successfully implemented a CEO and SBG leadership succession plan by designating Darius Adamczyk as Honeywells next Chief Executive Officer and Messrs. Terrence Hahn, Rajeev Gautam and John Waldron as the leaders of HBT, PMT and SPS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continued to improve our portfolio of businesses through the divestiture of the Honeywell Technology Solutions (HTSI) government services business and tax-free spin-off of the former Resins and Chemicals business as AdvanSix Inc. which, based on the trading price of AdvanSix shares on the spin date, represented the transfer to our shareowners of approximately $800 million in value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These transactions demonstrate our commitment to evolving our business portfolio to ensure alignment with our core technology strengths and focus on businesses which offer compelling organic and inorganic growth opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continued our track record of successful M&A activity by announcing and closing three significant transactions: the $1.5 billion acquisition of Intelligrated, a leader in supply chain and warehouse automation; the $515 million acquisition of Xtralis, a global provider of aspirating smoke detection systems, advanced perimeter security technologies, and video analytics software; and the $347 million acquisition of COM DEV, a leading satellite and space components provider.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All told, we have deployed over $8 billion of capital in acquisitions in 2015 and 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Excluding Pension Mark-To-Market (MTM) and 4Q 2016 Debt Refinancing Expenses
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OVERVIEW OF EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywells executive compensation program is designed to motivate and incentivize our executives to deliver sustainable, long-term financial outperformance for our shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In designing our executive compensation plans, the members of the Boards Management Development and Compensation Committee (MDCC) are focused on aligning our goals with the interests of our shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An important part of ensuring this alignment involves engaging with, and listening to, our shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC also benchmarks our executive compensation programs against a relevant group of peer companies, all of whom would be interested in recruiting our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In recent years, the MDCC has been particularly focused on the need to ensure a smooth transition in the leadership of our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On June 28, 2016, we announced that Darius Adamczyk would become Honeywells Chief Executive Officer on March 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective December 9, 2016, Mr. Adamczyk was elected to our Board of Directors reflecting the strength of leadership already demonstrated by Mr. Adamczyk during his tenure as President and Chief Operating Officer and the Boards confidence in the transition plan and his future performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our current Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, David Cote, will remain as an

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to announcing Mr. Cotes successor, we also announced the promotion of three individuals with long and outstanding track records at Honeywell to become SBG Presidents and Chief Executive Officers of three of our four SBGs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hence, in addition to aligning the interests of shareowners and executives through the design of Honeywells executive compensation program, the MDCC also demonstrated the effectiveness of our compensation programs in retaining and developing a new generation of leaders to continue the success achieved during the 15-year tenure of Mr. Cote.

sentences.text: The actions described above required strong executive leadership and a disciplined and focused business organization capable of simultaneously delivering superior 2016 financial results and executing complex strategic and financial projects certain to have long term benefits for our shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In terms of our 2016 financial performance, we once again overcame difficult challenges in the macro environment and end markets in which Honeywell operates to build on our three-year track record of solid relative and absolute performance in each of the key metrics relevant to our executive compensation programs: Sales, EPS, Segment Margin, Return on Invested Capital (or ROIC), TSR and Free Cash Flow.

sentences.text: 2016 Performance Relative to Peers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In ensuring alignment between pay and performance, the MDCC assesses Honeywells financial performance against two sets of peer data: a group o 18 companies that we call our Compensation Peer Group and a smaller subset of the Compensation Peer Group made up of Emerson Electric (EMR), General Electric (GE), 3M Corporation (MMM), and United Technologies (UTX), against whom we frequently compete for investment dollars.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We refer to these four companies as our Multi-Industry Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of these four companies is a multi-industrial company that has broadly overlapping institutional ownership, is covered by the same set of Wall Street research analysts that covers Honeywell, and operates in a similarly diverse set of end markets on a global basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See page 40 for a description of how the MDCC selected the Compensation Peer Group and changes made in 2016 to the composition of the Compensation Peer Group and page 33 for a description of how the MDCC uses certain non-GAAP financial information for both Honeywell and its peers in making compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For both the Compensation Peer Group and Multi-Industry Peer Group, the MDCC considers four primary indicators of financial performance: Sales growth, EPS growth, Net Income growth, and ROIC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table below summarizes our performance against both our Compensation Peer Group and Multi-Industry Peer Group:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Five-Year Net Income and EPS Growth vs. Peers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the last five years, our EPS performance has been particularly impressive because it was accomplished during a period when many companies in both peer groups used share repurchase programs to boost their EPS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hence, as the chart below demonstrates, net income growth lagged EPS growth for our Multi-Industry Peer Group and Compensation Peer Group, indicating that EPS growth was to some extent achieved by simply decreasing the number of shares outstanding through share buybacks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, the chart shows that Honeywells EPS* growth CAGR exceeded each of the Multi- Industry Peer Companies and the median for the Compensation Peer Group over a five year period despite the fact that we repurchased far fewer shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, the strong correlation between net income* and EPS* growth at Honeywell is important because it means that our growth is more reflective of our true operational performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also significant is that Honeywell grew EPS* faster than the Multi-Industry Peer Group while maintaining balance sheet capacity for future capital deployment.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After our 2016 Annual Meeting, we extended invitations to 32 shareowners representing 45% of our outstanding shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sixteen shareowners accepted our invitation, representing 33% of our outstanding shares.

sentences.text: Our Lead Director and Chairman of the MDCC directly participated in eight of these meetings with shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We heard very positive feedback on the financial performance of Honeywell, the high caliber of the management team and how well we are handling succession activities.

sentences.text: Executive Compensation > Our Compensation Philosophy & Approach
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OUR COMPENSATION PHILOSOPHY & APPROACH
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program creates long-term shareowner value through four key objectives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. Attract and Retain World-Class Leadership Talent with the ability and experience necessary to develop and execute business strategies, drive superior financial results, and nimbly adapt and react to constantly evolving end market conditions in an enterprise with our scale, breadth, complexity and global footprint;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Emphasize Variable, At-risk Compensation with an appropriate balance of near-term and long-term objectives that align executive and shareowner interests;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Pay for Superior Results and Sustainable Growth by rewarding and differentiating among executives based on the achievement of enterprise, business unit and individual objectives as well as efforts to advance Honeywells long-term growth initiatives; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. Manage Risk through Oversight and Compensation Design features and practices that balance short-term and long-term incentives, are not overly leveraged and cap maximum payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the MDCC reviews each NEOs four-year compensation history in total and each element of total annual direct compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC also reviews projected benefit payments under Honeywells retirement and deferred compensation plans, and any previously granted awards or grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This enables the MDCC to understand how each element of compensation interacts with the other elements and to see how current compensation decisions may affect future wealth accumulation and executive retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some of the key factors that shape the MDCCs overall assessment of performance and appropriate levels of compensation include (in no particular order of importance):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operational and financial performance  for the entire corporation and the relevant business group;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Aggressiveness of each executives financial goals and targets compared to peers as well as the business/macroeconomic conditions in which our businesses operate;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each executives long-term leadership potential and associated retention risk;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The extent which each executive made decisions or took actions which adversely impacted the current years financial performance but represented an investment which will benefit financial performance in future years;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The senior executive succession plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock price performance and total shareowner return;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Trends and best practices in executive compensation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Peer group comparisons, including performance, pay levels and related practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC reviews these factors over various time frames through the year to ensure a strong linkage between pay and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywells senior executives are recognized as industry leaders with backgrounds, depth of experience and management skills that are highly attractive to competitors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the MDCC prefers to address critical retention and succession risks through the existing compensation program, it eserves the right to take appropriate compensation actions that it believes are in the best interest of the Company and its shareowners, if deemed necessary to strengthen the succession plan and guard against the loss of key talent, especially during critical transition periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017     |     Proxy and Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareowners
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation > Our Compensation Philosophy & Approach
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW COMPENSATION DECISIONS ARE MADE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Decision making over executive compensation rests with the MDCC which holds six regularly scheduled meetings each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each meeting includes an executive session comprised solely of independent directors and those meetings are attended by the MDCCs independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meeting agendas contain items proposed by either management or the MDCC Members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In carrying out its responsibilities, the MDCC balances a number of important considerations, including
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The importance of aligning pay with Company and individual performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The need to attract, retain and reward executives with a proven track record of delivering consistent financial results and driving seed-planting initiatives that will create long-term shareowner value;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The complex multi-industry and global nature of our businesses and the importance of growth outside of the United States for future success
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The positioning of pay relative to the competitive market; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The importance of maintaining and executing on a thorough and rigorous succession planning process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC believes that, to create long-term shareowner value, Honeywells compensation programs must be financially competitive, and structured in a way that drives sustained performance against our strategic and financial goals and objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC is focused on maintaining a compensation program for Honeywell that emphasizes variable, at-risk compensation and has an appropriate balance of near-term and long-term objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC also considers shareowner feedback and the results of the annual advisory vote on executive compensation in making determinations regarding the structure of Honeywells pay program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OUR COMPETITIVE MARKET  COMPENSATION PEER GROUP
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC believes it is important to understand the relevant market for executive talent to ensure that Honeywells executive compensation program supports the attraction and retention of highly-qualified leaders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On an annual basis, our independent compensation consultant compiles compensation data on both our Compensation Peer Group and Multi-Industry Peer Group and presents this data to the MDCC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This review includes a comparison of each element of compensation for Honeywells executive officers (including the NEOs) with that of comparable positions in each Compensation Peer Group company, to provide the MDCC with an understanding of the pay positioning relative to the competitive marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On an annual basis, the MDCC also reviews the peer groups for appropriateness, with focus on companies that have one or more of the following attributes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business operations in the industries and markets in which Honeywell participates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similar revenue and/or market capitalization;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similar breadth of portfolio and complexity;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Global scope of operations and/or diversified product lines; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Demonstrated competitor for executive talent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recognizing we have completed 37 acquisitions and 30 divestitures since last changing our compensation peer group in 2009, the MDCC made changes to the Compensation Peer Group in 2016 in order to make it more representative of Honeywells evolving portfolio of businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, the MDCC viewed the former peer group as over weighted in aerospace and defense and under weighted in other key industries such as oil and gas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The changes made by the MDCC are consistent with MSCI and S&P Globals August 2016 announcement of a change in Honeywells sub-industry GICs code from Aerospace & Defense to Industrial Conglomerates to better reflect the Companys more diversified set of businesses with activities in multiple sectors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Compensation Peer Group companies are listed on page 41.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It should also be noted that in comparing the financial performance of Honeywell to both its Compensation Peer Group and the Multi-Industry Peer Group, the MDCC uses certain non-GAAP financial information that both Honeywell and each peer company utilizes in its financial disclosure and investor presentations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, we adjust Net Income and EPS by excluding the pension mark-to-market and 4Q 2016 debt refinancing expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC believes it is important to review the same type of financial information that our investors use in making investment decisions and that Wall Street research analysts use when comparing and contrasting us to our peers and making investment recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SUCCESSION PLAN ACTIVITIES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: David Cote will step down as CEO on March 31, 2017 and serve as Chairman until April 2018
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retention of highly-qualified leadership talent is critical to Honeywells continued performance and to successful succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC routinely considers, and reviews with the full Board, succession candidates for the CEO and other senior leadership positions under both near-term and long-term planning scenarios, taking into account demonstrated performance, leadership qualities and potential to take on more complex responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO succession plan announced on June 28, 2016 demonstrates the success of the MDCCs robust planning process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Darius Adamczyk, who will succeed Mr. Cote as Honeywells CEO on March 31, 2017, had served in roles of increasing responsibility in several different business units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most notably, Mr. Adamczyk was CEO of our PMT SBG from April 2014 until April 2016 when he was promoted to the newly created position of Chief Operating Officer (COO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In that capacity, all of the SBG CEOs reported to Mr. Adamczyk, and he was also responsible for implementation of our HOS Gold operating system across the enterprise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After Mr. Cote steps down as CEO on March 31, 2017, he will remain as Executive Chairman of the Board, subject to shareowner approval, until the Apri 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Coincident with the above announcements, in June 2016, Mr. Cote entered into a CEO Continuity Agreement which formalized the terms of his transition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This agreement, the details of which were included in the materials discussed with shareowners during 2016 outreach meetings, contained the following key terms:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cotes December 2014 retention agreement was entirely replaced as the new Continuity Agreement shortened his previously contemplated tenure as CEO and added certain obligations in connection with his continued service as Executive Chairman from
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017     |     Proxy and Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareowners
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation > Our Compensation Philosophy & Approach
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: March 31, 2017 until our April 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The effect of the replacement was to rescind the $5 million target value performance stock option grant issued to Mr. Cote in 2014 and to restore, as pensionable, $500,000 of his earned 2015 annual incentive compensation award which was previously excluded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the role of Executive Chairman, Mr. Cote will receive base compensation of $500,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the role as Executive Chairman, Mr. Cote will no longer be eligible for new grants of equity or performance plan units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2017 performance year, Mr. Cote will remain eligible for an annual incentive compensation award payment, to be made at normal timing, with his target award set at 50% of his actual 2016 ICP award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cote will be entitled to retain stock options and Growth Plan Units previously granted to him as CEO, with the full original 10-year term to exercise the stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cotes payout under the Growth Plan, if any, remains fully contingent on Honeywell achieving the previously defined levels of performance under the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cote will not be eligible for other compensation provided to the independent directors on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cote agreed to provide consulting services for five years post retirement (Honeywell to provide secretarial support, office space and IT support but no other compensation), in exchange for which the obligations under his non-competition agreement were extended for an equivalent period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cote will be permitted to lease available aircraft from Honeywells fleet, under a standard form aircraft lease agreement, with Mr. Cote reimbursing the Company for the cost of any usage at the maximum rate permitted by the FAA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC believes the CEO Continuity Agreement is critical to facilitating and supporting a smooth transition of the CEO role which is in the best interest of Honeywell and its shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentive Compensation Plan (ICP)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the MDCC implemented changes in the methodology for determining annual ICP awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These changes were in response to feedback from some shareowners desiring that some portion of the annual bonus be formulaic and that we reset payouts to individual targets each year instead of using prior year actual payouts as the baseline.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because these changes were announced midyear, they were partially implemented in 2016, but will be fully implemented for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, ICP awards were determined as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. Determination of Individual ICP Payout Percentages (ICP Payout %):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 80% of each ICP award determination was formulaic based on financial targets established by the MDCC at the beginning of 2016 (2016 ICP Goals).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 ICP Goals table below describes the financial targets and respective weighting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 20% of each ICP award was determined based on the MDCCs qualitative assessment of individual performance against objectives for 2016 an the significant accomplishments listed on pages 46-48.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The attainment percentage for both the formulaic and individual qualitative portions of the award can range from 0% to 200%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Determination of 2016 ICP Payout Amounts:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each NEO, the individual ICP Payout % determined in step 1 above was multiplied by their Baseline ICP Amount in determining their actual 2016 payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Messrs. Cote, Szlosek, Mahoney and Mikkilineni (Continuing NEOs), and consistent with past practice, their Baseline ICP Amount was equal to their prior year actual ICP award, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Mr. Adamczyk, who was promoted to COO in anticipation of the CEO succession plan action, the Baseline ICP Amount was equal to his 2016 base salary times 125%, which is his individual target ICP award percentage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional Change to be Made in 2017: In response to shareowner feedback, beginning with the determination of ICP awards for the 2017 performance year and for future periods, the MDCC will determine ICP awards using the approach described above, but discontinue the practice of using prior year actual bonuses as the ICP Baseline Amount for Continuing NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, the Baseline ICP Amount for all NEOs will be reset each year to be equal to their annual base salary times their individual target ICP award percentage.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC then reviewed and considered the key 2016 activities and accomplishments for each individual NEO, some of which are summarized below, as input for determining the appropriate individual attainment percentage for the qualitative portion of their 2016 ICP award:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued to build on an outstanding and lengthy track record of growth and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since Mr. Cote joined Honeywell, the Company has grown EPS by 337%, sales by 78%, segment profit by 206% and free cash flow by 185%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, under Mr. Cotes leadership, Honeywells dividend has increased by 315% and its market capitalization has grown by 330%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Worked closely with the Honeywell Board of Directors to architect and implement an effective CEO succession plan that will ensure Honeywells long- term financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Many of the portfolio and other restructuring activities which occurred in 2016 created a firm foundation for Mr. Cotes successor to sustain Honeywells past performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Led a major portfolio restructuring initiative pursuant to which Honeywell successfully split apart the former Automation and Control Solutions segmen to form two new segments  Home and Building Technologies (HBT) and Safety and Productivity Solutions (SPS)  in a manner that will ensure two segments that are more entrepreneurial, better focused on their end markets and customers, and able to opportunistically grow through M&A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Authorized a number of significant investments and expenses that negatively impacted 2016 EPS but which will benefit shareowners in 2017 and beyond, including: acceleration of certain OEM incentive payments by our Aero SBG to secure our position on key air transport and business jet
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: platforms and a significant increase in R&D expenditures compared to prior years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executed on several major transactions to better position Honeywell for future growth as an industrial software company including the acquisition of Intelligrated, divestiture of HTSI and spin-off of AdvanSix in a tax-free transaction to our shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Undertook a significant debt restructuring transaction in a manner that will enable Honeywell to lock-in historically low interest rates for a significant portion of its debt, thereby supporting a sustainable dividend payout ratio of approximately 38%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Szlosek
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Led a financial reporting, analysis and planning organization that successfully balanced delivery of 2016 financial commitments with long-term investments, including 2016 net income growth greater than our multi-industry peers and 8% growth in 2016 EPS (excluding pension MTM and 4Q 2016 debt refinancing expenses) based in part on 80 basis points of operational cost savings across the enterprise, a significant portion of which was identified and acted upon with finance department leadership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversaw execution of numerous transactions that are transforming Honeywells business portfolio including the successful deployment of $2.6 billion for high growth M&A, the spin-off of AdvanSix which created approximately $800 million of value for our shareowners (as measured on the date of the spin-off) and the divestiture of HTSI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Drove execution on a significant segment realignment whereby we separated our former ACS segment into two new reporting segments, HBT and SPS, that not only resulted in approximately $175 million in annual cost savings but will also better drive top-line growth through improved customer focus and technological innovation and improvement in the overall speed of decision-making in the organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Utilized HOS Gold to drive finance department excellence including reducing costs attributable to the finance department by $6.5 million annually while at the same time maintaining high levels of service and customer satisfaction among the business units that rely on Mr. Szloseks group for support.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supported the CEO and other leadership succession activities taking place in our C-suite as well as in three of our SBGs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Adamczyk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Demonstrated an ability to lead Honeywell as its next CEO through direct and personal leadership of the Corporations 2017 annual operating planning process that anticipates earnings growth of 6  10% (excluding pension MTM and 4Q 2016 debt refinancing expenses and divestitures) in 2017, successful oversight of a series of strategic transactions and portfolio restructuring initiatives, mentoring and supporting three new SBG CEOs as they transitioned into their new leadership roles, the conduct of strategic and business planning activities with each SBG, and establishment of credibility and confidence with investors, customers and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Established the building blocks for accelerating Honeywells organic sales growth by, among other things, overhauling the velocity product development process, one of Honeywells key enablers for launching and commercializing new products and technologies and creating a new organizational structure to support corporate-wide activities in the connected home, building, factory and aircraft area including the recruitment and hiring of a senior executive to coordinate this organic growth initiative.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Led initiatives to significantly grow the Corporations software revenues in several business units, including supply chain and warehouse automation where the successful acquisition and integration of Intelligrated has positioned Honeywell as a leader in the fast growing E-commerce warehouse automation solutions, software and services segment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As President and CEO of Performance Materials and Technologies since 2014 and for a portion of 2016, set the stage to ensure delivery of that SBGs segment profit commitments by nimbly reacting to significant headwinds in oil and gas end markets, expansion of UOPs and HPS share of demand, and substantially increasing revenues associated with new technologies and products, particularly related to software and cyber security.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Led productivity initiatives in several business units that materially improved margins including significant savings through improved organizational design of the newly formed HBT and SPS businesses and initiatives in Aero to drive productivity in advance of deteriorating conditions in the busines jet segment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversaw the integration of ten acquisitions made in the past 18 months which will contribute significantly to the growth trajectory of Honeywell over the mid- to near-term time horizon.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Mahoney
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Led our Aero SBG in several successful pursuits for key positions on new aircraft platforms, including the Citation Hemisphere large-cabin business jet and Cessna Aircraft cockpit where we provide the synthetic vision system, volumetric weather radar, and JetWaveTM cabin satellite communications system.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Led an Aero-wide manufacturing excellence effort that increased 2016 segment profit by $20 million by reducing waste and improving quality on over 2,500 parts while increasing yield on new entry into service products from 78% to 92%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued to expand our connected aircraft initiative through achievement of significant sales and operational milestones in the JetWaveTM suite o satellite communication and aircraft router equipment and completion of several successful acquisitions of equipment and software companies including COM DEV and Satcom1 businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversaw the successful launch of a new engine for the Textron Longitude which is also equipped with our auxiliary power units and mechanica systems.

sentences.text: Directed the overhaul of Aeros new product development program that significantly reduced cost variances and overruns while increasing customer milestone attainment to 92%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued to expand Aeros presence in High Growth Regions through the support of entry into service of the A350XWB airplane, which has a large amount of Honeywell content, COMAC ARJ21, Bombardier C-series and the HTS900 engine for the Bell 407.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Led Honeywells cross business RD&E center, Honeywell Technology Solutions (HTS), which grew by 5.5% to constitute ~35% of new product introduction (NPI) revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HTS centers of excellence were instrumental in enabling scale and speed in several key areas of product development including Human User Experience (HUE), Mobile Apps, Testing and Additive Manufacturing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Mikkilineni also led the establishment of HTS presence in Mexico for Latin America.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Drove significant improvement in our IT functions while reducing cost.

sentences.text: He did this through a 30% change in skill mix, the creation of large scale center of excellence and development of a business partnership mentality in the IT organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IT costs, and the number of individual IT software applications were reduced by ~5% and 35%, respectively, year-over-year while IT customer sentiment improved by 25%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued to play a leadership role in institutionalizing and deploying HOS Gold across our HOS Gold business enterprises.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We measured a 17% improvement in the HOS Gold maturity level across our Gold Business Units while 63% of our manufacturing sites are now HOS Silver.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In terms of improving and standardizing the way we launch new products, we believe that 76% of all Honeywell revenues are now derived from businesses that operate at a Bronze level or higher  when measured by our VPD or Velocity Product Development standard.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Led the development of a horizontal IoT platform, which we call Honeywell Sentience, through which we have already launched several connected new products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell Sentience was developed by a pool of our data scientists who combine cutting edge data science and machine learning that will leverage Honeywells access to big data in a number of end markets to offer analytics-based products to our customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Developed a plan to rationalize the ERP systems we use across our diverse businesses by conceiving nine common business processes and related data models, creating a dedicated team of ERP experts with a clear timeline, and beginning the process of implementing a robust ERP system integration that will greatly simplify and standardize our use of ERP systems and serve as a foundation to digitally transform the way we operate.

sentences.text: Maximum Aggregate and Individual ICP Award Caps
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the MDCC reviews the aggregate and individual funding caps for ICP awards, as defined by the incentive plan rules, and verifies that all paid awards and plan spending are within plan limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Aggregate Spending Caps:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum aggregate amount of ICP awards that can be paid to all senior executive employees, including the NEOs, is 2% of the Companys Consolidated Earnings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consolidated Earnings is defined as annual net income, adjusted to omit the effects of extraordinary items, gain or loss on the disposal of a business segment (other than provisions for operating losses or income during the phase-out period), unusual or infrequently occurring events and transactions, the effects of the annual fourth quarter mark-to-market adjustment that recognizes pension-related net actuarial gains and losses outside the corridor, and the effects of changes in accounting principles, all as determined in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.

sentences.text: LONG-TERM INCENTIVE COMPENSATION (LTI)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The mix of LTI awards to the NEOs for 2016 is summarized under the 2016 columns in the table below, along with a preview of how we will transition the LTI program over the next two compensation cycles in response to shareowner feedback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In summary, over the next two years, we intend to implement the following changes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reduction in use of Time-Based Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the past, our executives received a significant amount of their LTI in the form of time-based stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Going forward, our use of stock options will be reduced considerably.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes to our Growth Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the past, we relied heavily on biennial grants of cash-based Growth Plans Units, which had a two-year performance cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Going forward, we will replace the Growth Plan with a new Performance Plan that will grant annual share-based awards and have three-year overlapping performance cycles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Performance Plan will represent the most significant component of LTI and a relative metric will be added to the performance measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Elimination of biennial grants of RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the past, we granted discretionary RSUs on a biennial basis with 30% of the payout linked to performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we issued the last biennial grant of RSUs, but made 100% of the award performance contingent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2018, RSUs will be issued on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO Award: In February 2016, the MDCC granted Mr. Cote 600,000* annual stock options (same number as 2015), with an exercise price of $103.65* and a grant date value of $9,348,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This stock option grant represented 66% of his target long-term incentive opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC believes this award to be appropriate due to Mr. Cotes proven track record of leading Honeywell in a manner that has created long-term shareowner value and consistent financial and operational performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC also views this award as an appropriate incentive for Mr. Cote as he continues to provide strategic guidance to Honeywell in the role of Executive Chairman after he transitions from being CEO in March of 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As Executive Chairman, Mr. Cote will no longer be eligible for grants of stock options or other forms of LTI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cote has a history of holding stock options until close to their expiration date and generally exercises in the tenth year of the ten-year term (only exercised once in the ninth year), evidence of his commitment and confidence in the long-term performance of the Company.

sentences.text: Each NEOs future leadership potential.

sentences.text: The size of previous grants of stock options awarded to each NEO.

sentences.text: The amount of vested and unvested equity each executive holds.

sentences.text: Growth Plan Unit (GPU) Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Growth Plan is a long-term incentive plan which provides performance-contingent, cash-based incentive awards to focus executives on achievement of objective, two-year financial metrics that are aligned with Honeywells five-year financial goals which were communicated to shareowners in February 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The operational focus of the Growth Plan balances our focus on stock appreciation in the use of stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes that will be made to the Growth Plan as a result of shareowner feedback: The MDCC has had a long-standing belief that the two-year performance cycle of the Growth Plan provides a reasonable line of sight to set realistic stretch targets aligned with our longer-term objectives and that non-overlapping performance cycles facilitate the communication of progress against one set of long-term goals at a time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, over the past ten-years, market practices have evolved to a point where overlapping performance cycles of at least three years is considered best practice for long- term performance incentive plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In our outreach efforts, some shareowners have indicated their preference for three-year cycles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of shareowner feedback and our 2016 Say-on-Pay vote results, the MDCC determined that the awards for the 2016-2017 Growth Plan cycle would be the last biennial cycle awards, and that the Growth Plan will be replaced with a new share-based Performance Plan with three-year overlapping cycles beginning in 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC is confident that the design of the new Performance Plan will continue to incentivize executives to deliver on objective financial and operational metrics that will create long-term shareowner value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the MDCC retroactively changed the form of payout for Mr. Cotes 2016-2017 GPU award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cotes payout under this award will be in shares, not cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Growth Plan Mechanics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following provides more detail on how the Growth Plan works:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Two-year performance targets for each of the three metrics described below are established by the MDCC at the beginning of the two-year performance cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Metrics are established at the total company level (Total HON) and for each SBG.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GPUs are awarded to each NEO, at the same time GPU awards are made to other executives, in February of the first year of each two-year performance cycle (e.g., 2016 for the 2016-2017 cycle).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of the two-year performance cycle, Growth Plan payouts are determined on a purely formulaic basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each GPU has a target value of $100 ($50 when annualized), with performance metrics weighted equally in determining final payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each performance metric, a required minimum level of achievement (i.e., threshold) must be attained before the plan will fund for that particular goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plan payouts are capped at 200% of target (i.e., $200 for each GPU) to the extent plan maximums are met or exceeded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Corporate executives, including the CEO, payouts are based solely on the achievement of the Total HON level metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For SBG executives, 50% of their payout will be based on achievement of Total HON metrics, and 50% will be based on achievement of corresponding objectives for their respective SBG.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 50% of the earned payout amounts are paid in the first quarter of the year following the completion of a two-year performance cycle, and the remaining 50% is paid a year later.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This feature has been an effective retention tool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016-2017 Growth Plan: Performance Goals
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Total Revenue goal measures the effectiveness of our organic growth strategies including new product introduction and marketing and sales effectiveness as well as projected growth in our end markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use reported revenues for evaluating achievement of the Total Revenue goal, however we exclude the impact of acquisitions and divestitures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ROI goal ensures that our organic and inorganic revenue growth does not come at the expense of profitability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2015 ROI baseline was adjusted to 20.5% to reflect the inclusion of pre-2016 acquisitions not included in the prior cycle (as contemplated by our guidelines for treatment of transactions under the plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Focuses executives on driving continued operational improvements and delivering synergies from recent acquisitions.

sentences.text: The 2015 Segment Margin baseline was adjusted to 18.3% to reflect the inclusion of pre-2016 acquisitions not included in the prior cycle.

sentences.text: The following table presents the performance goals that were set for the 2016-2017 Growth Plan cycle:

sentences.text: 2016-2017 Growth Plan  Discussion on Rigor of Goals
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee sets Growth Plan goals at challenging levels that are consistent with Honeywells current five-year long-term plan covering 2014-2018 communicated to shareowners in February 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its goal-setting process, the Committee also considers the degree of stretch compared to targets for the prior Growth Plan cycle, actual results for the prior cycle, and reported financial results for the most recent, completed two-year cycle against performance for our Compensation Peer Group and Multi-Industry Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Total Revenue target for the 2016-2017 Growth Plan performance cycle was set at 5.1% CAGR, which reflects our pipeline of new products, technologies and services against a challenging slow-growth, macroeconomic environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Threshold and maximum payouts were set at +/- 3.5% of target, a range of performance deemed appropriate by the Committee based on our strategic growth plans and the macroeconomic outlook for our end markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an example of the review process for goal-setting, the Committee also evaluated the 5.1% CAGR Total Revenue target for 2016-2017 in the context of three factors, each of which underscores the degree of challenge:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target of 3.9% for the 2014-2015 Growth Plan cycle;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual results of 1.5% for the 2014-2015 Growth Plan cycle, resulting in a payout near threshold, which the Committee viewed as aligned with performance; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A comparison of Honeywells reported sales growth for the 2014-2015 period against peers - Honeywells reported growth was 100 basis points above the median for our Multi-Industry Peer Group and 1,200 basis points above the median for our Compensation Peer Group, effectively providing a threshold payout on that metric for 63rd percentile performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the Growth Plan Segment Margin and ROI goals, it is important to note that both of these are expansion goals, not simple targets, so the 2016-2017 targets are building on the improved margins and investment returns delivered in the prior cycle, which are already quite attractive relative to our peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016-2017 Segment Margin Expansion target anticipates 130 basis points of segment margin expansion during 2016 and 2017, bringing our segment margin to 19.6% of revenues over the two-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This reflects an increase over the Segment Margin Expansion target for the 2014-2015 performance cycle, which was 100 basis points, or 17.3% of revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As further indication of the degree of difficulty of the 2016-2017 Segment Margin Expansion target, the end-of-cycle margin of 19.6% is at the high end of the segment margin range established in February 2014 when we announced our five-year strategic plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 ROI Expansion target represents 330 basis points of ROI growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee set the target after adjusting ROI for 2015 to account for the large number of acquisitions completed during the 2014-2015 performance cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the previously disclosed 2014-2015 ROI goals were set before these acquisition activities, the 2016-2017 ROI expansion goal is well above both the target and actual ROI expansion levels for the 2014-2015 cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of our shareowner outreach, we have discussed the Growth Plan performance metrics, goals and performance with our top shareowners and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: they reiterated their positive feedback regarding the rigor of the goals and our practice of aligning the Growth Plan goals with Honeywells disclosed long- term targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes Being Made to the Timing of RSU Grants Based on Shareowner Feedback: In the past, RSU awards were considered on a biennial basis and issued off-cycle (typically in July) to correspond with the senior leadership succession plan review.

sentences.text: OTHER COMPENSATION & BENEFIT PROGRAMS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RETIREMENT PLANS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer certain retirement benefits to our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, NEOs may participate in broad-based plans including a defined benefit pension plan and a 401(k) savings plan that provides matching Company contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also maintain an unfunded supplemental retirement plan to replace the portion of an executives pension benefit that cannot be paid under the broad-based plans because of Internal Revenue Service (IRS) limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Mr. Cote is entitled to supplemental retirement benefits provided under a separate arrangement deemed necessary to recruit him to Honeywell in 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More information on retirement benefits can be found beginning on page 66.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NONQUALIFIED DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLANS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers (including the NEOs) may choose to participate in certain nonqualified deferred compensation plans to permit retirement savings in a tax-efficient manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers can elect to defer up to 100% of their annual ICP awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, executive officers may also participate in the Honeywell Supplemental Savings Plan maintained in order to permit deferral of base salary that cannot be contributed to the Companys 401(k) savings plan due to IRS limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These amounts are matched by the Company only to the extent required to make up for a shortfall in the available match under the 401(k) savings plan due to such IRS limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred compensation balances earn interest at a fixed rate based on the Companys 15-year cost of borrowing, which is subject to change on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with the long-term focus of the executive compensation program, matching contributions are treated as if invested in Company Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These plans are explained in detail beginning on page 70.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BENEFITS AND PERQUISITES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs are entitled to participate in Honeywell-wide benefits such as life, medical, dental, accidental death and disability insurance that are competitive with other similarly-sized companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs participate in these programs on the same basis as the rest of our salaried employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain excess liability coverage for management personnel, including the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO also receives additional life insurance benefits agreed at his time of hire in 2002 to replace lost benefits from his prior employer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our security policy requires the CEO and COO to use Honeywell aircraft for all air travel (business or personal) to ensure the personal security of these officers and protect the confidentiality of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO and COOs security plan also provides for home security and back-up power systems.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From time to time, we also permit other executive officers to use Honeywell aircraft for personal or business use.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION PRACTICES AND POLICIES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BEST PRACTICES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC regularly reviews best practices in governance and executive compensation and has revised Honeywells policies and practices over time, as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GOVERNANCE AND EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION POLICIES AND PRACTICES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowner Engagement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors and management engagement with shareowners
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon a Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eliminated excise tax gross-ups for any new officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For LTI awards granted after the 2014 annual meeting of shareowners, eliminated the right to single trigger accelerated vesting of options, RSUs and GPUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay ICP awards at the time they would typically be paid (no acceleration) and based on business performance rather than target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Balanced use of Performance Metrics to align pay with performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use different sets of operational metrics for ICP and the Growth Plan to drive top and bottom-line growth over multiple time frames aligned with our goal of sustained long-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Made RSU awards to officers contingent on three-year relative TSR performance against peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eliminated perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eliminated annual cash flexible perquisite allowance for executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No tax gross-ups on perquisites for officers and directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Recovery (Clawbacks)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Permit the recapture of incentive compensation from senior executives in the event of a significant financial restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Permit the cancellation and recovery of gains attributable to equity awards from employees who leave the Company to join a competitor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership and other requirements for executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Require officers to hold and maintain Common Stock equal in value to at least four times their base salary (six times for the CEO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Require officers to hold the net shares from RSU vesting and the net gain shares from option exercises for at least one yea
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Require automatic reinvestment of dividend equivalents on RSUs into additional RSUs, which vest according to the same schedule as the underlying RSUs to which they relate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prohibit granting of stock options with an exercise price less than the fair market value of Honeywells Common Stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prohibit repricing (reduction in exercise price or exchange for cash) or reloading of stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prohibit hedging and pledging of shares by our executive officers and directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employ an independent compensation consultant to review and advise the MDCC on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prohibit them from performing any other services for Honeywell.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regularly review the independence of any outside advisors as a component of the MDCCs charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Guard the Company against competitive harm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Obtain enhanced restrictive covenants in connection with annual equity grants and certain succession planning actions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation > Compensation Practices and Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RISK OVERSIGHT CONSIDERATIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC believes that balancing the various elements of Honeywells executive compensation program:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supports the achievement of competitive revenue, earnings and cash performance in variable economic and industry conditions without undue risk; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mitigates the potential to reward risk-taking that may produce short-term results that appear in isolation to be favorable, but that may undermine the successful execution of the Companys long-term business strategy and destroy shareowner value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following compensation design features guard against unnecessary or excessive risk-taking:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RISK OVERSIGHT AND COMPENSATION DESIGN FEATURES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Robust processes for developing strategic and annual operating plans, approval of capital investments, internal control over financial reporting and other financial, operational and compliance policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Diversity of the Companys overall portfolio of businesses with respect to industries and markets served (types, long cycle/short cycle), products and services sold, and geographic footprint.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review and Approval of Corporate, SBG and individual executive officer objectives by the MDCC to ensure that these goals are aligned with the Companys annual operating and strategic plans, achieve the proper risk/reward balance, and do not encourage unnecessary or excessive risk-taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation features that guard against unnecessary or excessive risk-taking include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay mix between fixed and variable, annual and long-term, and cash and equity compensation is designed to encourage strategies and actions th are in the Companys long-term best interests;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries are positioned to be consistent with executives responsibilities so they are not motivated to take excessive risks to achieve financial security;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive awards are determined based on a review of a variety of indicators of performance, thus diversifying the risk associated with any single indicator of performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Design of long-term compensation program rewards executives for driving sustainable, profitable, growth for shareowners;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vesting periods for equity compensation awards encourage executives to focus on sustained stock price appreciation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive plans are not overly leveraged with maximum payouts capped and design features that are intended to balance pay for performance with an appropriate level of risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC also has discretionary authority to adjust annual ICP payments, which further reduces the potential for negative business risk associated with such plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adoption of clawback policies, which provide for the recoupment of incentive compensation paid to senior executives in event of a significant restatement of Company financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback provisions in the Companys current stock plan also allow the Company to cancel shares or recover gains realized by an executive if non-competition provisions are violated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prohibition on hedging and pledging of shares by our executive officers and directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ownership thresholds in the Companys stock ownership guidelines for officers that require NEOs to hold shares of Common Stock equal to four times their current annual base salary (six times for the CEO), as detailed in the Stock Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Officers must also hold the net shares from vesting of RSUs and the net gain shares from option exercises for at least one year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon the MDCCs risk oversight and compensation policies, the risks arising from our compensation policies and practices are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on Honeywells operations or results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a full discussion of the role of the Board of Directors in the risk oversight process, see page 13 of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STOCK OWNERSHIP GUIDELINES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCC believes that our executives more effectively pursue our shareowners long-term interests if our executives hold substantial amounts of stock Accordingly, the MDCC adopted minimum stock ownership guidelines in May 2003 for all executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under these guidelines, the CEO must hold shares of Common Stock equal in value to six times his current annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other executive officers are required to own shares equal in value to four times their current base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares used in determining whether these guidelines are met include shares held personally, share equivalents held in qualified and nonqualified retirement accounts, and RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs currently maintain ownership levels well in excess of the minimum requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017     |     Proxy and Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareowners
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICER STOCK OWNERSHIP
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other NEOs (average)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: REQUIRED 4x base pay
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ACTUAL 21 base pay*
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: High Levels of Ownership reflect long-term focus and commitment of leadership team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * As of December 31, 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n addition, the stock ownership guidelines require officers to hold for at least one year the net shares from the vesting of RSUs or the net gain shares of Common Stock that they receive by exercising stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net shares means the number of shares obtained when an RSU vests, less the number of shares withheld or sold to pay applicable taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net gain shares means the number of shares obtained by exercising the option, less the number of shares the officer sells to cover the exercise price of the options and pay applicable taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After the one-year holding period, officers may sell net shares or net gain shares, provided that, following any sale, they continue to hold shares of Common Stock in excess of the prescribed minimum stock ownership level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RECOUPMENT/CLAWBACK
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines provide for the recoupment (or clawback) of incentive compensation paid to senior executives in the event of a significant restatement of financial results (a Restatement).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the guidelines, the Board can seek recoupment if and to the extent that:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the amount of incentive compensation was calculated based upon the achievement of financial results that were subsequently reduced due to a Restatement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the senior executive engaged in misconduct; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the amount of incentive compensation that would have been awarded to the senior executive had the financial results been properly reported would have been lower than the amount actually awarded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The complete text of the Corporate Governance Guidelines is posted on our website at www.honeywell.com (see Investors/Corporate Governance/Guidelines).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, if during the two-year period following an executive officers termination of employment with Honeywell, he or she commences employment with, or otherwise provides services to a Honeywell competitor without the MDCCs prior approval, then the Company reserves the right, for awards issued under the 2003, 2006, 2011 and 2016 Stock Incentive Plans, to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cancel all unexercised options; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recover any gains attributable to options that were exercised, and any value attributable to GPUs and RSUs that were paid, during the period beginning six months before and ending two years after the executive officers termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, we have entered into non-competition agreements with our executive officers that preclude them from going to work for a competitor for up to two years after termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The list of competitors and the duration of the non-competition covenant has been tailored, in each case, to the executive officers position and the competitive threat this represents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because money damages cannot adequately compensate Honeywell for violations of these non-competition covenants, we have a full range of equitable remedies at our disposal to enforce these agreements, including the ability to seek injunctive relief.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TAX DEDUCTIBILITY OF EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code restricts deductibility for federal income tax purposes of annual individual compensation in excess of $1 million to the NEOs (excluding the Chief Financial Officer) if certain conditions are not satisfied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MDCCs general policy is to preserve the deductibility of compensation paid to the NEOs while maintaining compensation programs that effectively attract, motivate and retain exceptional executives in a highly competitive environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nevertheless, the MDCC authorizes payments that might not be deductible if it believes they are in the best interests of the Company and its shareowners and consistent with the objectives of the Companys executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in certain years, individuals may receive non-deductible payments resulting from awards made prior to becoming an NEO.

sentences.text: PLEDGING AND HEDGING TRANSACTIONS IN COMPANY SECURITIES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers and directors are prohibited from pledging Honeywells securities or using Honeywells securities to support margin debt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All other employees must exercise extreme caution in pledging Honeywells securities or using Honeywells securities to support margin debt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hedging by directors, executive officers and employees on our restricted trading list is prohibited and is strongly discouraged for all other employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For this purpose, hedging means purchasing financial instruments (including forward sale contracts, swaps, collars and interests in exchange funds) that are designed to offset any decrease in the market value of Company stock held, directly or indirectly by them, whether the stock was acquired pursuant to a compensation arrangement or otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All employees and directors are prohibited from engaging in short sales of Honeywell securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, selling or purchasing puts or calls or otherwise trading in or writing options on Honeywells securities by employees, officers and directors is also prohibited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IMPACT OF ADVANSIX SPIN-OFF ON OUTSTANDING EQUITY AWARDS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective October 1, 2016, Honeywell completed the spin-off of its wholly owned subsidiary, AdvanSix Inc. (AdvanSix) to holders of record of Honeywell common stock as of September 16, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the terms of the underlying Stock Incentive Plans, unexercised non-qualified stock options and unvested and deferred restricted stock units (including Performance RSUs) that were outstanding as of the October 1, 2016 distribution date were adjusted to preserve their pre-spin-off economic value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each stock option or full value award was adjusted upward by multiplying the number of shares outstanding before the spin-off by a conversion ratio of 1.005724.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Outstanding stock option exercise prices were adjusted downward on a grant-by-grant basis, by dividing the exercise price before the spin-off by a conversion ratio of 1.005724.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of securities underlying unexercised stock options and stock awards, as well as the option exercise prices, listed on the Outstanding Equity Awards at 2016 Fiscal Year-End table below include the adjustments made as a result of the AdvanSix spin-off.

sentences.text: Summary Information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The REP is a tax-qualified pension plan in which a significant portion of our U.S. employees participate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The REP complies with tax requirements applicable to broad-based pension plans, which impose dollar limits on the amount of benefits that can be provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the pensions that can be paid under the REP for higher-paid employees represent a much smaller fraction of current income than the pensions that can be paid to less highly paid employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We make up for this difference, in part, by providing supplemental pensions through the SERP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Mr. Cote is entitled to an additional supplemental pension benefit that is described under the Contractual formula below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This supplementa pension benefit is also provided by the SERP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All SERP and Contractual benefits will be paid on the first day of the first month that begins following the 105th day after the later of the officers separation from service (as that term is defined in Internal Revenue Code Section 409A) or his earliest retirement date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
