sentences.text: Pension Benefit Calculation Formulas
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Within the REP and the SERP, a variety of formulas are used to determine pension benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Different benefit formulas apply for different groups of employees for historical reasons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, as we have grown through acquisitions, we have in many cases retained the benefit formulas under pension plans that were maintained by the companies that we acquired, in order to provide continuity for employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The differences in the benefit formulas for our Named Executive Officers reflect this history.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The explanation below describes the formulas that are used to determine the amount of pension benefits for each of our Named Executive Officers under the REP and the SERP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name of Formula Benefit Calculation REP Lump sum equal to (1) 6% of final average compensation (annual average compensation for the five calendar years out of the previous ten calendar years that produces highest average) times (2) credited service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Allied Salaried Single life annuity equal to (1)(A) 2% of final average compensation (average of compensation for the 60 consecutive months out of prior 120 months that produces highest average) times (B) credited service (up to 25 years), minus (2) 64% of estimated Social Security benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The final average compensation component of the formula was frozen and no amounts earned or paid after December 31, 2015 will be included, except that the annual incentive compensation paid in 2016 was included in 2015 compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Signal Single life annuity equal to (1)(A) 1.5% of final average compensation (average of compensation for the 60 consecutive months out of the last 120 that produces the highest average) times (B) credited service (with no limit on service), minus (2) (A) 1.5% of estimated Social Security benefits times (B) credited service up to 33 1/3 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The final average compensation component of the formula was frozen and no amounts earned or paid after December 31, 2015 will be included, except that the annual incentive compensation paid in 2016 was included in 2015 compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell Retirement Benefit Plan (HRBP) Single life annuity at age 67 equal to the sum of (1)(A) 1.0% of final average earnings (average earnings for the five calendar years out of the previous ten calendar years that produce highest average) times credited service up to 30 years, plus (B) 1/2400 of final average earnings for up to 60 months if credited service exceeds 360 months; and (2) 0.6% of final average earnings in excess of the covered earnings base (average of taxable wage bases for the 35-year period ending with the participants 67th birthday) times credited service up to 30 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The final average earnings component of the formula was frozen and no amounts earned or paid after December 31, 2015 will be included.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The covered earnings base is calculated using the 2015 taxable wage base for years after 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contractual For Mr. Cote, single life annuity equal to 60% of the average of final three years of base salary and bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each pension benefit calculation formula listed in the chart above, compensation includes base pay, short-term incentive compensation, payroll- based rewards and recognition and lump sum incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Calculations for pension formulas other than the REP and HRBP formulas include the annual incentive compensation in the year earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The REP and HRBP formulas include annual incentive compensation in the year paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of compensation taken into account under the REP is limited by tax rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of compensation taken into account under the SERP and the Contractual formula is not.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except as otherwise described below, the compensation changes described above for the Allied Salaried, Signal, and HRBP formulas also apply to the compensation taken into account under the SERP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit formulas above describe the pension benefits in terms of a lump sum cash payment (for the REP formula) or a single life annuity (for the other formulas).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants are entitled to receive their benefits in other payment forms, including, for example joint and survivor annuities, period certain annuities and level income payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the value of each available payment form is the same.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on prior elections, Messrs. Cote and Mikkilineni will receive their SERP benefits and any Contractual benefits in the form of a lump sum, and Mr. Mahoney will receive his SERP benefit in the form of an annuity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Allied Salaried formula also provides for early retirement benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant is eligible for early retirement if the participants age and years of service equal or exceed 60 and the participant has attained age 50 with at least five years of service or if the participants age and years of service equal or exceed 80 regardless of the participants age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the participant retires early, the participants benefit at normal retirement age is reduced by 1/4 of 1% for each month payments begin before age 62 (3% per year).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Social Security benefit reduction portion of the formula is reduced by 1/180 for each month benefits are paid between ages 60 and 65, and 1/360 for each month benefits are paid before the participants 60th birthday.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the participant retires early, his age and years of vesting service equal or exceed 85, his unreduced Social Security retirement age is 67 under the formula, and he was born between 1958 and 1960, the participants benefit at age 67 is educed by 0.35% for each full month benefits are paid before the first of the month following the participants 66th birthday.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2005, Honeywell has taken steps to limit deferred compensation amounts owed to executives by reducing the overall interest rate earned on new deferrals and accelerating the payout of deferred amounts, thereby limiting the period over which interest is earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These include changing the interest rate accruing on new deferrals under the Honeywell Supplemental Savings Plan (the SS Plan) and the Honeywell Salary and Incentive Award Deferral Plan for Selected Employees (the DIC Plan) from a fixed above-market rate to a rate that changes annually based on the Companys 15-year cost of borrowing; and requiring payment of the SS Plan or DIC deferrals to begin shortly after termination of employment in a lump sum unless the participant leaves the Company after reaching retirement (age 55 with ten years of service).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, cash dividend equivalents on vested deferred RSUs cannot be deferred and dividend equivalents on unvested RSUs are reinvested in additional RSUs and subject to the same vesting schedule as the underlying RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All deferred compensation amounts, regardless of the plan, are unfunded and unsecured obligations of the Company and are subject to the same risks as any of the Companys general obligations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of the aggregate balance at the last fiscal year is calculated by multiplying the total number of vested, deferred RSUs on December 31, 2016 by the closing price of a share of Common Stock on December 31, 2016 ($115.85), and then adding the cash value of deferred dividend equivalents and interest.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Supplemental Savings Plan allows Honeywell executives, including the Named Executive Officers, to defer the portion of their annual base salary that cannot be contributed to the Companys tax-qualified 401(k) plan due to the annual deferral and compensation limits imposed by the Internal Revenue Code and/or up to an additional 25% of base annual salary for the plan year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After one year of service, and to the extent amounts have not already been matched on a similar basis under the Companys 401(k) plan, Honeywell matched for deferrals posted to the SS Plan at the rate of 37.5% on the first 8% of eligible pay deferred for the first five years of match participation, and 75.0% on the first 8% of eligible pay deferred thereafter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Matching contributions are always vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Interest Rate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participant deferrals for the 2005 plan year and later are credited with a rate of interest, compounded daily, based on the Companys 15- year cost of borrowing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rate is subject to change annually, and for 2016, this rate was 3.64%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2017, this rate has been set at 2.69%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participant deferrals for the 2004 plan year and earlier are credited with a rate of interest, compounded daily, that was set by the Committee before the beginning of each plan year and is fixed until the deferral is distributed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to the 2005 plan year, the Committee would set the rate at an above-market rate to retain executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Above-market interest credited on SS Plan deferrals and reflected in the Summary Compensation Table on page 60 includes the difference between market interest rates determined by SEC rules and the interest credited under the SS Plan.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2006 plan year and later, a participant can elect to receive up to ten installments in lieu of the lump sum payment, which election will take effect only if the participant terminates employment after reaching age 55 with ten years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except in hardship circumstances, amounts deferred for the 2004 plan year and earlier will be distributed either in January of any subsequent year or in January of the year following termination of employment, as elected by the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The participant can elect to receive distributions in a lump sum or up to 15 annual installments.

sentences.text: Matching contributions are distributed in shares of Common Stock.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts deferred for the 2004 plan year and earlier may be withdrawn before the distribution date if a hardship exists or the participant requests an immediate withdrawal subject to a penalty of 6%.

sentences.text: Beginning in 2005, deferrals are credited with a rate of interest, based on Honeywells 15-year borrowing rate which is set annually at the beginning of the year (3.64% for 2016, 2.69% for 2017).

sentences.text: Amounts deferred for the 2004 plan year and earlier are credited with a rate of interest, compounded daily, that was set by the Committee before the beginning of each plan year and is fixed until the deferral is distributed.

sentences.text: Prior to the 2005 plan year, the Committee would set the total rate at an above-market rate to retain executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts deferred for the 2006 plan year and later will be distributed in a lump sum in January of the year following the termination of the participants active employment.

sentences.text: A participant can elect to receive up to ten installments in lieu of the lump sum payment, which election will take effect only if the participant terminates employment after reaching age 55 with ten years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except in hardship circumstances, amounts deferred for the 2005 plan year and earlier will be distributed either in January of any year three years after the compensation was earned or in January of the year following termination of the participants employment, as elected by the participant.

sentences.text: The participant could elect to receive non-hardship distributions in a lump sum or up to 15 annual installments.

sentences.text: Deferral of RSUs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Named Executive Officers may defer the receipt of up to 100% of their RSUs upon vesting based on an election made at the time of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive may defer payment to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A specific year that is four or more years from the vesting year; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the year following the executives termination of active employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive can also choose to receive payment in a lump sum or up to 15 annual installments and can also elect at the time of grant to accelerate the form and timing of payment following a change in control to a lump sum paid no later than 90 days following the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For grants made before July 2004, an executive could also defer dividend equivalents in cash and such amounts are credited with interest at a 10% rate, compounded daily, until payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The practice of deferring dividend equivalents in cash ended in July 2004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Above-market interest related to the deferred dividend equivalents reflected in the Summary Compensation Table on page 60 includes the difference between market interest rates determined by SEC rules and the 10% interest credited by the Company on the pre-July 2004 grants, the terms of which cannot be amended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of the SERP Plan, the SS Plan, the DIC Plan, the deferred RSUs and the unvested dividend equivalents are subject to the requirements of, and regulations and guidance published by, Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code.

sentences.text: Executive Compensation > Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: POTENTIAL PAYMENTS UPON TERMINATION OR CHANGE IN CONTROL
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This section describes the benefits payable to our Named Executive Officers in two circumstances:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination of Employment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Contro
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior Severance Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These benefits are determined primarily under a plan that we refer to as our Senior Severance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the Senior Severance Plan, other of our benefits plans, such as our annual incentive compensation plan, also have provisions that impact these benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These benefits ensure that our executives are motivated primarily by the needs of the businesses for which they are responsible, rather than circumstances that are outside the ordinary course of business, i.e., circumstances that might lead to the termination of an executives employment or that might lead to a Change in Control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, this is achieved by assuring our Named Executive Officers that they will receive a level of continued compensation if their employment is adversely affected in these circumstances, subject to certain conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that these benefits help ensure that affected executives act in the best interests of our shareowners, even if such actions are otherwise contrary to their personal interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is critical because these are circumstances in which the actions of our Named Executive Officers may have a material impact upon our shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we set the level and terms of these benefits in a way that we believe is necessary to obtain the desired results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The level of benefit and the rights to benefits are determined by the type of termination event, as described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that these benefits are generally in line with current market practices and are particularly important as, except with respect to our CEO, we do not maintain employment agreements with our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits provided under the Senior Severance Plan are conditioned on the executive executing a full release of claims and certain non-competition and non-solicitation covenants in favor of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The right to continued severance benefits under the plan ceases in the event of a violation of such covenants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we would seek to recover severance benefits already paid to any executive who violates such restrictive covenants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of a Change in Control, severance benefits are payable only in the event that both parts of the double trigger are satisfied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That is,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) there must be a Change in Control of our Company, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii)(A) the Named Executive Officer must be involuntarily terminated other than for cause, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii)(B) the Named Executive Officer must initiate the termination of his own employment for good reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, in response to shareowner feedback, the Company also amended its stock incentive plan in 2014 to eliminate automatic single-trigger vesting of equity and Growth Plan awards that are rolled- over upon a Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Summary of BenefitsTermination Events
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table summarizes the termination of employment and Change in Control benefits payable to our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excise Tax Reimbursement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: U.S. tax laws may impose an excise tax on employees who receive benefits in connection with a Change in Control in certain circumstances and subject to certain conditions.

sentences.text: In 2009, the Company amended the Senior Severance Plan to eliminate excise tax gross-ups for officers not already eligible for such treatment prior to January 1, 2010.

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, Messrs. Cote and Mahoney were the only NEOs grandfathered under this provision.

sentences.text: Based on the Companys expectation about how the excise tax would be calculated in the event of an actual Change in Control transaction, no NEO would have been subject to excise tax if a Change in Control had occurred on December 31, 2016.

sentences.text: Impact on Equity-Based Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This section describes the impact of a termination of employment or a Change in Control on outstanding stock options and RSUs held by our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional information about these awards is included in the Outstanding Equity Awards Table on page 63 of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table below shows the value of outstanding unvested stock options and RSUs held by our Named Executive Officers as of December 31, 2016, based on the closing price of a share of Common Stock as reported on the New York Stock Exchange on December 31, 2016 ($115.85).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards are scheduled to vest and to expire on various dates in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described below, the vesting of these awards will be accelerated in certain termination of employment circumstances and upon a Change in Control (other than the equity awards granted after April 28, 2014, which will remain outstanding to the extent assumed by the successor upon a Change in Control).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, stock options will remain outstanding for different periods depending on the circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value to a Named Executive Officer of these provisions depends on the vesting period and remaining terms of the awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, the value to a Named Executive Officer of accelerating the vesting of an option by one month is very different from the value of accelerating the vesting of an option by three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table below does not distinguish between acceleration of vesting in these two different circumstances, or assign a value to the other provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rather, it only indicates the aggregate amount of the awards to which these provisions would apply at December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination or Change in Control Impact on Outstanding Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The treatment of stock options and RSUs following termination of employment depends on the plan under which the awards were granted, as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2006 Stock Incentive Plan of Honeywell International Inc. and its Affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For awards granted after 2006, RSUs and unvested stock options become vested in full upon death, disability, or a Change in Control, and RSUs also vest following full retirement on a pro-rata basis based on the number of complete years of service between the grant date and the retirement date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In other circumstances, unvested options and RSUs are immediately forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance awards vest at target upon a Change in Control unless the award agreement provides otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs and performance awards that vest upon a Change in Control shall be paid within 90 days (subject to any deferral election).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following termination of employment, participants (or their beneficiaries) have until the earlier of the original expiration date or the following period in which to exercise vested options:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Three (3) years in the event of death, disability or a voluntary or involuntary termination (other than for cause) after qualifying for early retirement (age 55 and ten years of service) or full retirement (age 60 and ten years of service);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One (1) year in the case of any other involuntary termination without cause; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thirty (30) days in the case of a voluntary termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2011 Stock Incentive Plan of Honeywell International Inc. and its Affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For awards granted before July 2012, the vesting rules are the same as under the 2006 Stock Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs granted after June 2012 do not vest at all following full retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For awards granted after April 2014 unvested stock options and RSUs shall not automatically vest upon a Change in Control if rolled over or continued by the successor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In such case, vesting shall only occur if a participants employment is terminated, either by the successor without cause or by the participant for good reason (that is, double trigger vesting), within two years following a Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double trigger vesting applies to other awards granted after this date also.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance awards shall vest at target, unpaid growth plan awards where the performance cycle has ended shall be paid within 90 days, and growth plan awards where the performance cycle has not ended shall be paid within 90 days on a pro-rata basis through the termination date based on target performance through the termination date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rules for post-termination exercise periods for vested stock options under this plan are the same as the 2006 Stock Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Stock Incentive Plan of Honeywell International Inc. and its Affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs do not vest at all following retirement (regardless of retirement age).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unvested stock options and RSUs shall not automatically vest upon a Change in Control if rolled over or continued by the successor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In such case, vesting shall only occur if a participants employment is terminated, either by the successor without cause or by the participant for good reason (that is, double trigger vesting), within two years following a Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double trigger vesting applies to other awards granted also.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance awards shall vest at target, unpaid growth plan awards where the performance cycle has ended shall be paid within 90 days, and growth plan awards where the performance cycle has not ended shall be paid within 90 days on a pro-rata basis through the termination date based on target performance through the termination date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rules for post-termination exercise periods for vested stock options under this plan are the same as the 2006 Stock Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Mr. Cote, stock options and RSUs continue to remain outstanding and vest as scheduled, if his employment is terminated by the Company other than for cause or by him for good reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cotes unvested options and RSUs vest immediately if he dies or becomes disabled.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, under the terms and conditions of an agreement entered into with Mr. Cote on July 29, 2011 for retention and succession planning purposes (the 2011 Cote Agreement), stock options (other than stock options subject to performance conditions) granted prior to April 1, 2015, and more than six months prior to Mr. Cotes retirement date, will become fully vested on his retirement date, and he will have the full remaining term to exercise any such vested stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The same terms and conditions apply to stock options subject to performance conditions; however, vesting will not occur until the end of the applicable performance cycle and then, only to the extent the applicable performance metrics have been satisfied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, under the terms and conditions of another agreement entered into with Mr. Cote on June 28, 2016 for retention and succession planning purposes (the 2016 Cote Agreement), if Mr. Cote remains as CEO until March 31, 2017, stock options that do not automatically vest pursuant to the 2011 Cote Agreement will remain outstanding and continue to vest as scheduled after his retirement date, and he will have the full remaining term to exercise any such vested stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These provisions shall apply if Mr. Cotes employment is terminated by the Company other than for cause prior to March 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, if Mr. Cote retires after March 31, 2017, he shall receive a Growth Plan payout for the 2016-17 Growth Plan cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such payout shall be made in shares of Honeywell stock and shall be subject to a one year holding requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits described in the 2016 Cote Agreement only apply to the extent that, prior to March 31, 2017, Mr. Cote does not engage in an external CEO search, adheres to certain non-competition and non- solicitation covenants, refrains from certain outside activities that could otherwise affect his ability to devote 100% of his energy to the Companys affairs, and is not terminated for cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Defined Terms Used in This Section
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As used in our plans, the following terms are assigned the meanings summarized below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Term   Summary of Definition Change in Control    the acquisition of 30% or more of the Common Stock;      the purchase of all or part of the Common Stock pursuant to a tender offer or exchange offer;      a merger where Honeywell does not survive as an independent, publicly-owned corporation;      a sale of substantially all of Honeywells assets; or      a substantial change in Honeywells Board over a two-year period;      additionally, under the Senior Severance Plan, any event that the Committee, in its discretion, determines to be a Change in Control for purposes of that plan; provided that under the 2006, 2011 or 2016 Stock Incentive Plan, each of the events described above would only be a Change in Control if it constitutes a change in control event within the meaning of United States Department of Treasury Regulation 1.409A-3(i)(5)(i).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination for cause  (for Mr. Cote)    in carrying out his duties, Mr. Cote engages in conduct that constitutes willful gross neglect or gross misconduct resulting in material economic harm to Honeywell; or    Mr. Cote is convicted of a felony.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination for cause (for other Named Executive Officers)    clear and convincing evidence of a significant violation of the Companys Code of Business Conduct;    the misappropriation, embezzlement or willful destruction of Company property of significant value;    the willful failure to perform, gross negligence or intentional misconduct of significant duties that results in material harm to the business of the Company;    the conviction (treating a nolo contendere plea as a conviction) of a felony (whether or not any right to appeal has been or may be exercised); or    clear and convincing evidence of the willful falsification of any financial records of the Company that are used in compiling the Companys financial statements or related disclosures, with the intent of violating Generally Accepted Accounting Principles or, if applicable, International Financial Reporting Standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination for good reason (for Mr. Cote)    the Board assigns Mr. Cote duties that are inconsistent with the duties associated with his position as Chairman of the Board and CEO of the Company;      the failure of Mr. Cote to be retained as Honeywells Chairman of the Board and CEO;      any significant diminution of Mr. Cotes position, authority, duties or responsibilities;      the failure of the Company to have any successor entity expressly assume Honeywells obligations under Mr. Cotes employment agreement;      the occurrence of acts or conduct by the Company, the Board or our officers, representatives or stockholders that prevent Mr. Cote from, or substantively hinder him in, performing his duties or responsibilities under his employment agreement;      any material breach of Mr. Cotes employment agreement by the Company that goes unremedied; the provision of notice by the Company to Mr. Cote that his employment agreement will not be extended; or      any other action that would be considered Good Reason under the Senior Severance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination for good reason (for other Named Executive Officers)    a material diminution in the Named Executive Officers authority, duties or responsibilities;    a material decrease in base compensation;  a material decrease in base compensation; a material reduction in the aggregate benefits available to the Named Executive Officer where such reduction does not apply to all similarly-situated employees;    any geographic relocation of the Named Executive Officers position to a location that is more than 50 miles from his or her previous work location;    any action that constitutes a constructive discharge; or    the failure of a successor to assume these obligations under the Senior Severance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee Report
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AUDIT COMMITTEE REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee consists of the six directors named below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each member of the Audit Committee is an independent director as defined by applicable SEC rules and NYSE listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board of Directors has determined that Mr. Paz, Mr. Davis and Ms. Washington are audit committee financial experts as defined by applicable SEC rules and that Mr. Paz, Mr. Burke, Mr. Davis, Ms. Deily and Ms. Washington satisfy the accounting or related financial management expertise criteria established by the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management is responsible for Honeywells internal controls and preparing the Companys consolidated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys ndependent accountants are responsible for performing an independent audit of the consolidated financial statements in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States) and issuing a report thereon.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is responsible for overseeing the conduct of these activities and, subject to shareowner ratification, appointing the Companys independent accountants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As stated above and in the Committees charter, the Committees responsibility is one of oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee does not provide any expert or special assurance as to Honeywells financial statements concerning compliance with laws, regulations or generally accepted accounting principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In performing its oversight unction, the Committee relies, without independent verification, on the information provided to it and on representations made by management and the ndependent accountants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviewed and discussed Honeywells consolidated financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2016 with management and the independent accountants for 2016, Deloitte & Touche LLP (Deloitte).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management represented to the Audit Committee that the Companys consolidated financial statements were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee discussed with Deloitte matters required by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Boards Auditing Standard No. 1301, Communications with Audit Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also reviewed, and discussed with management and Deloitte, managements report and Deloittes report on internal control over financial reporting in accordance with Section 404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywells independent accountants provided to the Audit Committee the written disclosures required by the applicable requirements of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board regarding the independent accountants communications with the audit committee concerning independence, and the Committee discussed with the independent accountants their independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee concluded that Deloittes provision of non-audit services, as detailed in the table below, to the Company and its affiliates is compatible with Deloittes independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the Audit Committees discussion with management and the independent accountants and the Audit Committees review of the representations of management and the report of the independent accountants, the Committee recommended that the Board of Directors include the audited consolidated financial statements in the Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016 filed with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee Report > Proposal No. 4: Approval of Independent Accountants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 4: APPROVAL OF INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee, which consists entirely of independent directors, is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the Companys independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is recommending approval of its appointment of Deloitte & Touche LLP (Deloitte) as independent accountants for Honeywell to audit its consolidated financial statements for 2017 and to perform audit-related services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These services include reviewing our quarterly interim financial information and periodic reports and registration statements filed with the SEC and consultation in connection with various accounting and financial reporting matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If shareowners do not approve, the Audit Committee will reconsider the appointment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviews non-audit services proposed to be provided by Deloitte to determine whether they would be compatible with maintaining Deloittes independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has established policies and procedures for the engagement of Deloitte to provide non-audit services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviews and approves an annual budget for specific categories of non-audit services (that are detailed as to the particular services) which Deloitte is to be permitted to provide (those categories do not include any of the prohibited services in the auditor independence provisions of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This review includes an evaluation of the possible impact of the provision of such services by Deloitte on the firms independence in performing its audit and audit-related services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 5: INDEPENDENT BOARD CHAIRMAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal has been submitted by the Teamsters General Fund, 25 Louisiana Avenue, NW, Washington, DC 20001 (the beneficial owner of 70 shares of Common Stock).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In June 2016, the Board of Directors bolstered the structure and scope of the Lead Director role to ensure independent oversight continues to be rigorous and comprehensive in light of the CEO transition from David Cote to Darius Adamczyk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED: The stockholders of Honeywell International Inc. (the Company), ask the board of directors to adopt a policy that, whenever possible, the board chairman should be a director who has not previously served as an executive officer of the Company and who is independent of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For these purposes, a director shall not be considered independent if, during the last three years, he or she
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: was affiliated with a company that was an advisor or consultant to the Company, or a significant customer or supplier of the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to Mr. Cotes retirement as Chairman of the Board in April 2018, the Board will make the determination of whether to reinstate a combined CEO/Chairman role or separate them and appoint an independent Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: was employed by or had a personal service contract(s) with the Company or its senior management;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: was affiliated with a company or non-profit entity that received the greater of $2 million or 2% of its gross annual revenues from the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: had a business relationship with the Company that the Company had to disclose under the Securities and Exchange Commission regulations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: has been employed by a public company at which an executive officer of the Company serves as a director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: had a relationship of the sort described above with any affiliate of the Company; and,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: was a spouse, parent, child, sibling or in-law of any person described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy should be implemented without violating any contractual obligation and should specify how to select an independent chairman if a current chairman ceases to be independent between annual shareholder meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compliance with the policy may be excused if no independent director is available and willing to be chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SUPPORTING STATEMENT: The Board of Directors, led by its chairman, is responsible for protecting shareholders long-term interests by providing independent oversight of management, including the Chief Executive Officer, in directing the corporations affairs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This oversight can be diminished when the chairman is not independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board oversight is of critical importance at the Company given the recent leadership transition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2002, CEO David M. Cote served as both chairman and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company announced in June 2016 that Mr. Cote would be replaced in his CEO role by Mr. Darius Adamczyk in March 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The announcement also stated that Mr. Cote would continue as a Company employee and serve as the chairman of the board until the 2018 shareholder meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The timing of the CEO succession plan makes the 2017 shareholder meeting the right moment to adopt this policy for an independent chairman of the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We view the alternative of a lead outside director, even one with a robust set of duties, as inadequate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Several respected institutions recommend chair independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CalPERS Corporate Core Principles and Guidelines state that the independence of a majority of the Board is not enough: the leadership of the board must embrace independence, and it must ultimately change the way in which directors interact with management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We urge you to vote FOR this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board of Directors RecommendationThe Board of Directors unanimously recommends that the shareowners vote AGAINST this proposal for the following reasons:

sentences.text: In 2016, the Board of Directors strengthened the scope of the Lead Director role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In June 2016, the Board of Directors bolstered the structure and scope of the Lead Director role to ensure independent oversight continues to be rigorous and comprehensive in light of the CEO transition from David Cote to Darius Adamczyk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The enhancements to the Lead Director role were also a response to shareowner sentiment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, the position was appointed on a one-year rotation based on seniority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board determined that a permanent Lead Director would be better suited to manage the leadership transition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board intends to review the Lead Directors performance on a biennial basis and, as appropriate, re-elect or elect one of its members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the enhanced structure, the Board formally adopted selection criteria it will use in designating the Lead Director, including, among other things
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ensuring that the Lead Director is able to commit the time and level of engagement required to fulfill the substantial responsibilities of the Lead Director role;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: possession of effective communication skills to facilitate engagement with key stakeholders; and,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: experience broadly in line with the scope and complexity of Honeywells operations as well as its corporate strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To better facilitate a smooth leadership transition, the Board also added several new responsibilities to the Lead Director role including, among other things:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: providing guidance on key strategic and operational Board agenda topics;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: periodic consultation with management about the scope and content of materials provided to the Board; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: serving as ex-officio member of each Board committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The new duties of the Lead Director complement the already existing responsibilities of the Lead Director:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: review, and have the opportunity to make changes to, Board meeting agendas and schedules;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: review, and have the opportunity to make changes to, Board presentation materials;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: preside at all executive sessions of the Board where the Chairman is not present;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: serve as liaison between the Chairman and the independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: be available for consultation and direct communications with our shareowners; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: call meetings of the non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jaime Chico Pardo has been elected Lead Director to serve through 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board elected Mr. Jaime Chico Pardo as the Companys Lead Director to serve until at least the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Chico Pardo is currently the President and Chief Executive Officer of ENESA, a private fund investing in the Mexican energy and health care sectors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board based its decision on the formal selection criteria described above including, among other things: Mr. Chico Pardos long board tenure; deep knowledge and understanding of Honeywell, its technologies and the end markets that it serves; global business experience and knowledge of relevant technologies; experience leading Telefonos De Mexico, a large, complex business organization; and, effective communication skills with other Board members, shareowners and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To accommodate Mr. Chico Pardos expanded Lead Director role, the Board also announced that Mr. Chico Pardo will relinquish his position as the Chairman of the Retirement Plans Committee, to be replaced by Dr. Bradley Sheares, who currently is a member of that committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Chico Pardo, in his role as Lead Director, participated in a significant number of the shareowner outreach meetings we conducted this year, many  person and the rest by phone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, he was able to hear feedback directly from our shareowners and engage with them in productive and constructive dialogue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Chico Pardo was then able to report back to the Board on these discussions based on first-hand knowledge.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has served shareowners extremely well and deserves the right to exercise its independent judgment in determining whether and when to separate the roles of Chairman and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywells Corporate Governance Guidelines do not establish a fixed rule as to whether the offices of Chairman and CEO should be vested in the same person or two different people, but rather specify that board leadership structure is best considered as part of the CEO succession planning process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, the Board retains the flexibility to separate the two roles if and when the Board believes that a separation will improve our performance or better serve shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When Mr. Adamczyk replaces Mr. Cote as CEO on March 31, 2017, Mr. Cote will become Chairman and serve in that role through the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the CEO and Chairman roles will be separated at that time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to Mr. Cotes retirement as Chairman of the Board in April 2018, the Board will make the determination of whether to reinstate a combined CEO/Chairman role or separate them and appoint an independent Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal would remove the Boards discretion and independent judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, the Board would be required to separate the two roles, replacing its judgment and insight into how Honeywell functions best with a one size fits all mandate that may, or may not,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of our regular shareowner outreach program, we have discussed this shareowner proposal on multiple occasions with our largest shareowners who told us that our lobbying activities and membership in trade associations were not a source of concern or investment risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The revised disclosure provides more details on management and Board oversight of our lobbying activities.

sentences.text: We have not made any political contributions using corporate funds since at least 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have received this shareowner proposal four times in the past five years and on each occasion, the proposal has received support from less than 33% of our shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Indeed, in 2016 support for this proposal fell 2% and only 27% of our shareowners voted in favor of the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each time we received this proposal, we have discussed it with our largest shareowners during our regular engagement and outreach activities concerning governance and compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These shareowners have consistently told us that our lobbying activities and membership in trade associations is not a source of concern or investment risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, our largest shareowners have consistently told us that they are satisfied with our disclosure on lobbying, membership in trade associations and political contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our disclosure on political lobbying and contributions is robust and was ranked in the top tier by the 2016 CPA-Zicklin Index of Corporate Political Disclosure and Accountability.

sentences.text: In 2013, we significantly updated our disclosure on political lobbying and contributions.

sentences.text: * A list of our top legislative and regulatory priorities, most of which relate to key elements of our brand promise of making society safer and more energy efficient and improving public infrastructure;

sentences.text: * Greater details on management and board oversight of our lobbying activities; and

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: VOTING PROCEDURES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: YOUR VOTE IS VERY IMPORTANT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the meeting, please take the time to vote your shares as soon as possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTICE AND ACCESS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SECs Notice and Access rule allows companies to deliver a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (Notice of Internet Availability) to shareowners in lieu of a paper copy of the proxy statement and related materials and the Companys Annual Report to Shareowners (the Proxy Materials).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice of Internet Availability provides instructions as to how shareowners can access the Proxy Materials online, contains a listing of matters to be considered at the meeting, and sets forth instructions as to how shares can be voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares must be voted either by telephone, online or by completing and returning a proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares cannot be voted by marking, writing on and/or returning the Notice of Internet Availability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Notices of Internet Availability that are returned will not be counted as votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instructions for requesting a paper copy of the Proxy Materials are set forth on the Notice of Internet Availability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING AVAILABILITY OF PROXY MATERIALS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Materials are available at www.proxyvote.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will need to enter the 12-digit control number located on the Notice of Internet Availability or proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: METHODS OF VOTING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowners of Record
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are registered directly in your name with Honeywells transfer agent, Wells Fargo Shareowner Services, you are considered the shareowner of record of those shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowners of record can vote via the Internet at www.proxyvote.com, by scanning the QR code with a mobile device, by calling +1 (800) 690-6903 or by signing and returning a proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Votes submitted by Internet, mobile device or telephone must be received by 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Daylight Time on April 23, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Owners
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in a stock brokerage account, by a bank, broker, trustee, or other nominee, you are considered the beneficial owner of shares held in street name and these proxy materials are being forwarded to you by your bank, broker, trustee or nominee who is considered the shareowner of record of those shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the beneficial owner, you have the right to direct your bank, broker, trustee or nominee on how to vote via the Internet or by telephone or mobile device if the bank, broker, trustee or nominee offers these options or by signing and returning a proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your bank, broker, trustee or nominee will send you instructions for voting your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NYSE rules prohibit brokers from voting on Proposal Nos. 1, 2, 3, 5 and 6 without receiving instructions from the beneficial owner of the shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the absence of instructions, shares subject to such broker non-votes will not be counted as voted or as present or represented on those proposals and so will have no effect on the vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please note that brokers may not vote your shares on the election of directors in the absence of your specific instructions as to how to vote so we encourage you to provide instructions to your broker regarding the voting of your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Votes directed by Internet, mobile device or telephone through such a bank, broker, trustee or nominee must be received by 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Daylight Time on April 23, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants in Honeywell Savings Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants in the Honeywell stock funds within Honeywell savings plans are considered the beneficial owners of the shares held by the savings plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The trustee of each savings plan is the shareowner of record for shares held by Honeywell stock funds within that plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants in Honeywell stock funds within Honeywell savings plans can direct the trustee of the relevant plan to vote their shares via the Internet at www.proxyvote.com, by scanning the QR Code with a mobile device, by calling (800) 690-6903 or by signing and returning a proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The trustee will vote shares as to which no directions are received in the same ratio as shares with respect to which directions have been received from other participants in the relevant plan, unless contrary to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: So we encourage you to provide instructions to the trustee regarding the voting of your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directions provided by Internet, mobile device or telephone must be received by 5:00 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Daylight Time on April 20, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017     |     Proxy and Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareowners
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: REVOKING YOUR PROXY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether you vote or direct your vote by mail, telephone, mobile device or via the Internet, if you are a shareowner of record or a participant in Honeywell stock funds within Honeywell savings plans, unless otherwise noted, you may later revoke your proxy by:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sending a written statement to that effect to the Corporate Secretary of Honeywell;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Submitting a properly signed proxy with a later date;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting by telephone, mobile device or via the Internet at a later time (if initially able to vote in that manner) so long as such vote or voting direction is received by the applicable date and time set forth above for shareowners of record and participants in Honeywell savings plans; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting in person at the Annual Meeting (except for shares held in the savings plans).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your shares through a bank, broker, trustee or nominee and you have instructed the bank, broker, trustee or nominee to vote your shares, you must follow the directions received from your bank, broker, trustee or nominee to change those instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: QUORUM; VOTE REQUIRED; ABSTENTIONS AND BROKER NON-VOTES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The required quorum for the transaction of business at the meeting is a majority of the total outstanding shares of Common Stock entitled to vote at the meeting, either present in person or represented by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regarding Proposal No. 1, Honeywells By-laws provide that in any uncontested election of directors (an election in which the number of nominees does not exceed the number of directors to be elected), any nominee who receives a greater number of votes cast FOR his or her election than votes cast AGAINST his or her election will be elected to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares not represented in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting, abstentions and broker non-votes will have no effect on the election of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The By-laws also provide that any incumbent nominee who does not receive a majority of votes cast in an uncontested election is expected to promptly tender his or her resignation to the Chairman of the Board following the certification of the shareowner vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This resignation will be promptly considered through a process managed by the Corporate Governance and Responsibility Committee, excluding any director nominees who did not receive a majority of votes cast to elect him or her to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of a majority of shares present or represented and entitled to vote on each of Proposal Nos. 3 through 6 is required for approval of these proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will be counted toward the tabulation of votes present or represented on these proposals and will have the same effect as votes against these proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The frequency of the advisory vote on executive compensation (Proposal No. 2) receiving the greatest number of votes (every one, two or three years) will be considered the frequency recommended by the shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares not represented in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting and broker non-votes will have no effect on the vote outcome of these proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the votes on Proposal Nos. 2 and 3 are advisory and not binding on the Board or the Company, the Board will take into consideration the outcome of the votes when making future decisions regarding executive compensation and the frequency of the advisory vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OTHER BUSINESS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board knows of no other matters to be presented for shareowner action at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If other matters are properly brought before the meeting, the persons named as proxies in the accompanying proxy card intend to vote the shares represented by them in accordance with their best judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CONFIDENTIAL VOTING POLICY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is our policy that any proxy, ballot or other voting material that identifies the particular vote of a shareowner and contains the shareowners request for confidential treatment will be kept confidential, except in the event of a contested proxy solicitation or as may be required by law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We may be informed whether or not a particular shareowner has voted and will have access to any comment written on a proxy, ballot or other material and to the identity of the commenting shareowner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the policy, the inspectors of election at any shareowner meeting will be independent parties unaffiliated with Honeywell.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESULTS OF THE VOTE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will announce preliminary voting results at the Annual Meeting and publish them on our website www.honeywell.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting results will also be disclosed on a Form 8-K filed with the SEC within four business days after the Annual Meeting, which will be available on our website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy and Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareowners     |     2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance At The Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SHARES OUTSTANDING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the close of business on February 24, 2017, there were 760,718,312 shares of Common Stock outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share outstanding as of the February 24, 2017 record date is entitled to one vote at the Annual Meeting on each matter properly brought before the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ELIMINATING DUPLICATE MAILINGS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial owners of Common Stock who share a single address may receive only one copy of the Notice of Internet Availability or the Proxy Materials, as the case may be, unless their broker, bank, trustee or nominee has received contrary instructions from any beneficial owner at that address.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This practice, known as householding, is designed to reduce printing and mailing costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any beneficial shareowner(s) sharing a single address wish to discontinue householding and receive a separate copy of the Notice of Internet Availability or the Proxy Materials, as the case may be, they may contact Broadridge, either by calling (800) 542-1061, or by writing to Broadridge, Householding Department, 51 Mercedes Way, Edgewood, New York, 11717.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ELECTRONIC ACCESS TO THE PROXY MATERIALS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can elect to receive future proxy materials by email, which will save us the cost of producing and mailing documents to you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowners may enroll to receive proxy materials electronically as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowners of Record: If you are a registered shareowner, you may request electronic delivery when voting for this meeting on the Internet at www.proxyvote.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Holders: If your shares are not registered in your name, check the information provided to you by your bank or broker, or contact your bank or broker for information on electronic delivery service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ATTENDANCE AT THE ANNUAL MEETING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at the Annual Meeting is limited to our shareowners or their legal proxy holders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a shareowner of record and plan to attend the meeting, please mark the appropriate box on your proxy card or follow the instructions provided when you vote via the Internet, mobile device or telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held by a bank, broker, trustee or nominee and you plan to attend, please send written notification to Investor Relations, Honeywell, 115 Tabor Road, Morris Plains, NJ 07950, and enclose evidence of your ownership of shares of Common Stock as of February 24, 2017 (such as a letter from the bank, broker, trustee or nominee confirming your ownership or a bank or brokerage firm account statement).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The names of all those planning to attend will be placed on an admission list held at the registration desk at the entrance to the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shareowners attending the meeting will be asked to provide proof of identification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held by a bank, broker, trustee or nominee and you have not provided advance written notification that you will attend the meeting, you will be admitted to the meeting only if you present evidence of ownership of shares of Common Stock as of February 24, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are not a shareowner, you will be admitted only if you have a valid legal proxy and form of photo identification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are receiving a legal proxy from a shareowner of record, you must bring a form of photo identification and a legal proxy from the record holder to you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are receiving a legal proxy from a street name shareowner, you must bring a form of photo identification, a legal proxy from the record holder (i.e., the bank, broker or other holder of record) to the street name holder that is assignable, and a legal proxy from the street name holder to you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reserve the right to limit the number of representatives for any shareowner who may attend the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017     |     Proxy and Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareowners
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OTHER INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SHAREOWNER PROPOSALS FOR 2018 ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREOWNERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order for a shareowner proposal to be considered for inclusion in Honeywells proxy statement for the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareowners pursuant to Rule 14a-8 of the SEC, the proposal must be received at the Companys offices no later than the close of business on November 9, 2017 Proposals submitted thereafter will be opposed as not timely filed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a shareowner intends to present a proposal for consideration at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareowners pursuant to the procedures contemplated in Honeywells By-laws, outside the processes of SEC Rule 14a-8 or the proxy access provisions in Honeywells By-laws, Honeywell must receive notice of such proposal not earlier than December 25, 2017 and not later than January 24, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Otherwise the proposal will be considered untimely under Honeywells By-laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice must contain a brief description of the proposal, the reasons for conducting such business, the name and address of the shareowner and the number of shares of Honeywells Common Stock the shareowner beneficially owns, and any material interest of the shareowner in such business, all as provided in Honeywells By-laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If this information is not supplied as provided in Honeywells By-laws, the proposal will not be considered at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Honeywells proxies will have discretionary voting authority on any vote with respect to such proposal, if presented at the meeting, without including information regarding the proposal in its proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shareowner that wishes to submit a shareowner proposal should send it to the Vice President and Corporate Secretary, Honeywell, 115 Tabor Road, Morris Plains, New Jersey 07950.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR NOMINATIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Access Nominations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywells By-laws allow a single shareowner or a group of up to 20 shareowners who have held at least 3% of Honeywell stock for at least three years to submit director nominees (the greater of 20% of the Board or two directors) for inclusion in Honeywells proxy statement if the shareowner(s) and the nominee(s) satisfy the requirements specified in Honeywells Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice must be received by the Corporate Secretary of Honeywell at the address above not earlier than the 150th day and not later than the close of business on the 120th day prior to the first anniversary of the date the definitive proxy statement was first released to shareowners in connection with the preceding years Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Proxy Access Nominations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywells By-laws state that any shareowner of record entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting who intends to make a nomination for director, must notify the Corporate Secretary of Honeywell in writing not more than 120 days and not less than 90 days prior to the first anniversary of the preceding years Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice must meet other requirements contained in the By-laws, a copy of which can be obtained from the Corporate Secretary of Honeywell at the address above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXPENSES OF SOLICITATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell pays the cost of preparing, assembling and mailing this proxy-soliciting material.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the use of the mail, proxies may be solicited by Honeywell officers and employees by telephone or other means of communication.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honeywell pays all costs of solicitation, including certain expenses of brokers and nominees who mail proxy material to their customers or principals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Georgeson Inc. has been retained to assist in the solicitation of proxies for the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareowners at a fee of approximately $12,500 plus associated costs and expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Order of the Board of Directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jeffrey N. Neuman Vice President and Corporate Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HONEYWELL his Proxy is Solicited on Behalf of the Board of Directors of Honeywell International Inc Annual Meeting of Shareowners - April 24, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The undersigned hereby appoints Darius Adamczyk, David M. Cote, Katherine L. Adams and Jeffrey N. Neuman as proxies (each with the power to act alone and with full power of substitution) to vote, as designated herein, all shares the undersigned is entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting of Shareowners of Honeywell International Inc. to be held on April 24, 2017, and at any and all adjournments thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxies are authorized to vote in their discretion upon such other business as may properly come before the Meeting and any and all adjournments thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote on the election of Directors and the other proposals described in the accompanying Proxy Statement may be specified on the reverse side.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The nominees for Director are: Darius Adamczyk, William S. Ayer, Kevin Burke, Jaime Chico Pardo, David M. Cote, D. Scott Davis, Linnet F. Deily, Judd Gregg, Clive Hollick, Grace D. Lieblein, George Paz, Bradley T. Sheares, and Robin L. Washington.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IF PROPERLY SIGNED, DATED AND RETURNED, THIS PROXY WILL BE VOTED AS SPECIFIED ON THE REVERSE SIDE OR, IF NO CHOICE IS SPECIFIED, THIS PROXY WILL BE VOTED FOR THE ELECTION OF ALL NOMINEES FOR DIRECTOR, FOR 1 YEAR ON PROPOSAL 2, FOR PROPOSALS 3 AND 4 AND AGAINST PROPOSALS 5 AND 6.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By signing this instruction and proxy card, or by voting by phone or Internet, the undersigned hereby directs The Northern Trust Company, as Trustee for the Honeywell Savings and Ownership Plan, and Banco Popular, as Trustee for the Honeywell Puerto Rico Savings and Ownership Plan, to vote, as designated herein, all shares of common stock with respect to which the undersigned is entitled to direct the Trustee as to voting under the plan at the Annual Meeting of Shareowners of Honeywell International Inc. to be held on April 24, 2017, and at any and all adjournments thereof.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN
